Activate the camera when needed: it is useful to activate your camera so that participants can see you and perceive some of the body language
and perceive some of your body language, especially if you are the presenter
Preserve your private environment by using a background or simply blurring it.
Limit background noise: move to a quiet room and turn off your microphone when you are not speaking.
Distribute the floor in a structured way: you can ask participants to mute the microphones and use the "raise your hand" option.
This can be done by asking participants to mute microphones and use the "raise your hand" option in Teams when they want to speak.
Share documents, CR, notes and recordings of the meeting
Get feedback to improve your meetings
Now you know everything, it's time to play!



Raise your hand to speak

Indicate to the presenter that you wish to speak by activating the Raise your hand icon.



Use the whiteboard

During a meeting, use the whiteboard to illustrate your ideas just as you would with a regular board.
1) Click on the Share Content icon in the action bar
2) In the share tray, choose the whiteboard tool
3) Illustrate your ideas with the tools available at the top of the page
Use the wheel to export the page as an image.



Survey meeting attendees

You want to make quick decisions during a meeting or a discussion? Use the Forms survey tool built into Teams meetings:
1. in the conversation pane
2) Click on the ... at the bottom of the conversation and again on the ..., Messaging extensions.
3) Search and choose the Forms tool
4) Enter your question, you can check the Multiple Answers option and opt for anonymous answers
5) Click on preview,then save the form by clicking on Send.
6) To participate: click on the answer of your choice and send your answer
7) View the results from the meeting conversation



Record a meeting

You can record team meetings and share them later with your absent team members, but be careful, even if the participants will be visually informed of the recording when it starts, you must absolutely have their agreement before.
To record a call :
1. click on ... in the call action bar
Click on Start recording.
The recording of the meeting is accessible from the conversation of the meeting.
To stop recording the meeting, click on the Stop Recording button



Live transcribe your Teams meeting speeches

In a Teams meeting, you can start a live transcript of participants' speeches. The text appears in real time next to the video or audio of the meeting, including the name of the person speaking.
1. Click "... " in the call action bar
2. Select **start transcription*, all participants will receive a notification that the meeting is being transcribed. The transcript will appear on the right side of the screen.
3. Once the meeting is complete, the transcript is immediately available in the meeting event in the calendar. Participants will be able to download it as a .docx file.



Use live subtitles in a Teams meeting

If you are deaf or hard of hearing, Microsoft cares about you, you can now participate and access the content of a meeting in real time by activating subtitles (in English only for now).
This feature is also useful for people with different language skills and participants in noisy environments by offering them another way to follow a meeting.
To use live subtitles in a meeting:
1. Select the ...
2. Click on Enable Live Captions.
N.B:
To ensure that your live captions are as accurate as possible, try to follow these best practices:
- Speak clearly, slowly and directly into the microphone, and respect the distance from it
- Avoid background noise
- Avoid having participants speak at the same time.



Collaborate in Team Mode with Teams

Teams is a collaborative tool that brings colleagues together around files, folders, informal or formal exchanges and numerous applications. Teams allows your team to stay organized and centralize all important items in a single location. You can create a teams space to work in team or project mode.



Manage a team

Always ask yourself about the objectives of this team before you create it!
Share your team documents



Create a team

Depending on the company, rights to create a team may not be activated for all users. If this is the case for you, please contact your IT department.
The creation of a team can be done in a few clicks,
1. Go to the "Teams" section
2. Click on "Join or create a team" at the bottom of the page
3. Click on "Create a Team"
4. Select the option "Create a team from scratch"
5. Choose a Private Team for collaboration with your team members only
6. Name your team
7. Add members and define their roles

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Access a team

To access a team, you must be a member.
This team is automatically added in your Teams, you will be able to see it in the teams pane.
If it is not the case :
-It may be in "your hidden teams"
or
-You are not a member of the team, If this is the case, ask an owner to become a member
Don't hesitate to use the search bar in Teams (at the top of the page) to find a team: just type the name of the team or a word composing it.



Hide a team

To hide a team :
1. click on "..." next to the team name
2.click on "Hide".

Warning: even if you hide a team, you are still a member of it.



Delete a team

Attention: by deleting a team, you delete its content.
If you are sure you want to delete a team:
1. Click on "..." next to the team name.
2. Click on "Delete Team".
3. Click on " i understand that everything will be deleted"
4. Reply to "Delete Team", if you are sure
This team is deleted!

Note: To delete a team, you must be the owner.
If you delete a team by mistake, contact your IT department, they can restore it.



Define authorization levels for your team members

When creating a team as an owner you can define the level of permissions you will grant to members and guests.
At any time you can promote the level from member to owner or the other way around.
Let's discover in this module, what is their role!



Add a member to a team

Only an owner can add a member. He can also add another owner or a guest.
A member can suggest a new one in a proposal which will have to be validated by an owner.
Members are often added to a team when it is created but even after the process remains simple.
To add a member:
1. Click on "..." next to the team name.
2. Click on "Add a member".
3. Choose the name of the person you wish to add.
4. Click on "Add**"
5. Define the role of the member
Now you have a new team member!



Configure a team

&&&&&&&&



Remove a member from a team

To delete a member:
1. Click on "..." next to the team name
2. Click on " Manage team".
3."Click on "the cross**" next to the name of the person you want to delete
The member is now deleted.



Owners

To manage a team's permissions:
1. Click on the "..." in front of the team name.
2. Then click on "Manage Team
Here you can:
- Change the authorization level of the team members, so you can promote a member to owner or vice versa
- Manager team membership requests
- Modify authorizations and channel settings
-Etc.



Members

Team owners have all rights. They can :
-Add or remove members
-Add or remove channels
-Modify the Teams structure
-Add and remove tabs
-Give specific rights to members
-Delete or archive the team
- etc



Add guests

A member is a contributor to your Teams space, he is subject to the permissions imposed by the owner, Nevertheless he can create, modify, delete and share documents.
He can add channels and customize the space if he is authorized to do so.



Leave a team

It is possible to invite someone outside your organization to join a team or channel in Teams. As a guest, this person will have access to team conversations, meetings and files.
To add a guest to your team in Teams:
1. Click ... next to the team name
2. Click Add Member.
3. Enter the guest's email address
4. Click on Add
Guests will receive a welcome email invitation with a link to the team
**Note: Anyone with a business or consumer email account, such as Outlook, Gmail or other, can join a team as a guest.



Create channels by topic

Each channel is dedicated to a specific topic, department or project. By default, all team members can create and access standard channels
You also have the same rights on a team's channels regardless of your authorization level. Follow a channel to receive notifications of new posts.



Standard channels

A channel is dedicated to a specific topic, department or project. By default, all team members can create or access standard channels
To create a channel and organize your team:
1. Click on "..." in front of your team
2. Then, click on "Add a channel"
3. Name the channel
4. Add a description to the channel
5. Choose the privacy level:
- Standard: accessible to all members of your team
- Private: accessible only to a group of your team members
- Shared : accessible only to people you choose from your organization or other organization
Note: People from outside your org can only be members of a shared channel.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Add members to a private channel

As a private channel owner, you can add or remove members in that channel. Each person you add must first be a team member.
To add members of your team to a private channel:
1. To the right of the private channel, click "..."
2. Then click on "Add Members"



Check the usage report

It is possible to view the usage statistics of each channel and measure the activity.
1. click on ... in front of the channel name
2. Click on Manage Channel.
3. Go to the Analysis tab
4.choose the time scale to see the statistics



Show or hide a channel

To organize your space by displaying only the channels you actively participate in, you can hide certain channels.
To hide a channel:
1. Click on ..." to the right of the channel
2. Then click on "Hide".

To display a channel:
1. Open the team
2. Then, click on "hidden channels" at the bottom of the channel list
3. Then click on "..." to the right of the channel
4. Then click on "Show"

Note: In this way, you only hide the channels for yourself. Other team members can choose their own channels to hide if they wish.



Delete a channel

To delete a channel:
1. Click on "..." in front of the channel name
2. Then click on "Delete this channel".
Note: You cannot delete the "General" channel of a team regardless of your authorization level.



Restore a channel

In case of a wrong action, it is possible to recover a channel.
To restore a channel deleted by mistake:
1. Click on "..." in front of the team name
2. Then click on "Manage Team".
3. Go to the "Channels" tab
4. In "Deleted" Click on "Restore" to the right of the channel

You will recover all the conversations of the channel as well as the files, tabs, etc.
**Note: You have 21 days to restore a deleted channel.



Customize your team spaces

To facilitate your users' experience, you can customize and enrich your team space by adding various Office 365 applications: Excel, SharePoint library, Forms survey, intranet link, etc.



Customize channel's tabs

To access another SharePoint library, website, ... from your Teams team, you need to add it as a tab:
1. Copy the URL of the SharePoint library or website
2. Click on "+" at the top of the channel
3. Choose "Library" or "Website"
4. Add an explicit "name" for your tab
5. Paste the URL you copied earlier
6. Validate by clicking on "Save".
The tab is added, check if the website or the library are accessible to the whole team before adding them



Add an existing form to a channel

To publish an existing Form to a team:
1. Click the "+" button in the channel to add the form
2. Choose the Forms application
3. In the window that opens, select the "Add an existing form" option
4. Select the form you wish to add from the list
5. Set the level of sharing of the form with the team:
-Collect Responses: the form to be filled out
-Display results: the results
-Collaboration: the construction of the form
6. Validate by clicking on "Save".



Centralize meeting notes using OneNote

Each time a Teams team is created, an associated Notepad is created with the name of your team. Add it as a tab to make it accessible
You can use this Notepad to centralize and share your meeting reports:
1. Click on the "+" button at the top of channel
2. Click on the "OneNote " icon
3. Choose the Team Notebook (it has your team name on it)
4. Click on "Save ".
You can organize your Notepad by adding sections by theme, just like your channels.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Create a knowledge base with a Wiki

A Wiki allows the creation, modification and collaborative illustration of pages within a team. Each page is made of different sections, you can record any kind of information, for example about your contacts, your processes, create a FAQ, share your ideas, ...
Formatting features are available to enhance your texts.



Turn a document into a Tab

Make important documents easily accessible by adding them as a tab to your Teams channel
To do this:
1. Go to the "Files" tab of the concerned channel
2. Click on "..." in the selected document
3. Select the option "Make this a Tab ".
A tab is then added and allows you to display the document directly.



Contributor Roles on Teams

A member is a contributor to your Teams space, he is subjected to the authorizations imposed by the owner, he can nevertheless create, modify, delete or share documents.
He can add channels, customize the space if he is authorized to do so.



Add documents, folders

Teams allows documents to be organized and stored in SharePoint spaces dedicated to your team.
For each Channel , a Files tab is added, where you can store any kind of documents. These are accessible at any time and to all members of your team. This space is also called "SharePoint Library".



Create a folder

To create a folder in Teams
1. On team's channel home page, go to the Files tab
2. Click on the New button in the horizontal menu
3. Select Folder.
4. Name the Folder
5. Click on Create



Create a document from Teams

You want to create a new document in Teams, it's easy:
1. Select the channel of the team that will host the document
2. Go to the "Files" tab,
3. Click on the "New" button
4. Select the Application of your choice to create your document
5. Give your document a name, then click on "Create".

Note: this document will be visible and editable by all members of the channel.
Tip: To make this new document known, you can create a new conversation from this file by clicking on the Conversation button once the document is open in Teams, then mention the channel with the @** sign followed by its name.
Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Save an office document in Teams

If you have synchronized your library, you can create a document with office , when saving, select the library, the folder, name your document, then save
In the "Files" tab of your document:
1. Select "Save As"
2. Select "Sites ..."
3. Select from the list, the Teams name, then the channel and finally the folder to save your document.



Load an existing document into Teams

You want to upload an existing document to Teams? :
1. Select the channel in the team that will host the document
2. Go to the "Files" tab,
3. Choose the location
4. Click on the "Upload " button and select the document to upload
You can also load a document with a simple "drag and drop" from the explorer.

Warning: this document will be visible and editable by all channel members.



Collaborate on shared documents

By default, all documents shared in a team are accessible by all team members. You can according to the rights assigned, create, modify, delete, access the version history of a document, ‚Ä¶



Co-edit on files

Once a document is stored in a Teams space, it is automatically shared with all its members. The documents remain accessible at any time.
You can therefore modify it simultaneously with several people. This is called co-editing.
The benefits of collaborative spaces:
- Documents remain available even when they are opened by other people
- You can view in real time the modifications made by others
- A unique version of the document is created
- Access to the version history is permanent, at any time you can restore an old version.
- Send of sharing links, no more documents in attachment manual consolidation of modifications
- You can modify documents from any professional device: PC, Tablet, Smartphone
To edit a document:
1. right-click on the document
2.click on "Open".
Select the application you want to open the document with.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Restore an old document version

Automatic saving is activated by default for Office 365 users. A version history is then generated for each document, the number of versions of the same document depends on the configuration of your SharePoint library. At any time you can restore an old version.
To access the version history, proceed as follow:
Right click on the document in Teams
Click on "Open in Sharepoint"
Right click on the document again and then click on "Version History"
Click the down arrow next to the desired version when you hover over it, then click Restore, Open, or Delete

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Create an alert for a document

Setting up an alert on a document allows you to receive a notification in case of changes on it.
Beware of infobesity with notifications, it is therefore important to use alerts carefully.
To configure an alert on a document in Teams, you must first open it in SharePoint.
Right click on the document in Teams
Click on "Open in Sharepoint"
Right click on the document or folder you want to track.
Click on "Notify me
Customize your alert in the window that opens and click OK.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Access your documents from the file explorer

The synchronization allows you to access your documents from the file explorer, in case you lose your connection, they remain available and as soon as the network is restored, the synchronization is automatically restarted.
Be careful not to synchronize every SharePoint library, this could saturate your hard disk space and generate synchronization errors.
1. In Teams, open the tab "Files" in the desired channel
2. Choose the folders you want to synchronize, then start the synchronization by clicking on "Synchronize" at the top
3. In your file explorer, you will find the synchronized folders
Note: You can find the module on synchronization, its benefits and limits in the OneDrive course: "Accessing your documents in synchronized mode".

To find out more:
Click here to see the video ‚èØ



PlannerEN

Planner is a tool that allows you to organize, assign and follow up on tasks during a project for example through a plan.
Click to read document üìñ



Plan your team' s tasks with Planner

Planner allows you to collaborate on a project with a team, view progress reports and track individual assignments.
It allows you to organize teamwork with intuitive, collaboration and visual task management.
Let's find out how to create and assign tasks while staying organized.



Create a Plan

Planner also called Task by Planner and To Do is a tool that allows you to organize, assign and track tasks during a project for example through a plan.



Create a plan from a team

You work in project mode, and want to plan and follow the tasks of your project, you can create your plan directly from the concerned Teams channel.
Once the tasks are assigned, you will be able to update them and track their progress.
To add a plan in Teams:
1.Go to the channel of the team where you want to add a plan
2) Then click on the + (Add a tab) button in the upper right corner.
3) In the window that opens, select the Tasks by Planner and To Do tool
4) Click on create a new plan and name it
5) If you want to notify your Team about the tab's creation, check the box Post to the channel about this tab
6) Finally, click on Save
Planner is added as a Tab to your channel
WARNING : The planner tool cannot be added to a private channel.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Add an existing plan to a current project

You work in project mode, and want to plan and follow the tasks of your project, you already created your plan and want to add it to the concerned channel in Teams.
Once the tasks are assigned, you will be able to update them and track their progress.
To add a plan in Teams:
1.Go to the channel of the team where you want to add a plan
2) Then click on the + (Add a tab) button in the upper right corner.
3) In the window that opens, select the Tasks by Planner and To Do tool
4) Click on Use an existing plan from this team and research it
5) If you want to notify your Team about the tab's creation, check the box Post to the channel about this tab
6) Finally, click on Save
Planner is added as a Tab to your channel
WARNING : The planner tool cannot be added to a private channel.



Create a plan from the MS365 portal

From the portal MS365 at Office.com you can create a new plan directly in the Planner app.
1. Open the app, click on + new plan on the left.
2. Name your plan
3. Select a privacy level
PUBLIC : all members of the organisation can see the content
PRIVATE : only members I add can see the content.
4. Once the privacy level has been chosen, clik on create plan
5. To manage members, click on Members at the top right of the plan. The members you invite automatically receive an email notification.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Create and assign tasks to your teams

Let's discover together how to create and assign tasks while staying organized



Create and assign tasks

Pour cr√©er une t√¢che :
To create a task :
1. simply click on + Add a task 2.
2.name the task
3.set a due date
Assign the task, a list of plan members is displayed, choose the people you want to assign the task to. You can also assign a task directly to yourself.
5) Then click on Add a task**.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Use labels to categorize your tasks

Labels allow you to organize your tasks by subject. To access the labels, click on your task to open it, then :
1.click on Add a label
Click on the pen in front of a color to rename it
3.give the name you want and click on the task Enter 4.
Click on the label of your choice and it will appear directly on the task.
You have 6 labels for all your tasks.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Add buckets

Buckets allow you to organize your task by columns. By default, there is only one bucket named To do.
1. If needed, rename this bucket by clicking on it.
2. To add a new column, click on Add new bucket

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Define task priority

You can define priorities for each task, it is very useful for the person(s) who will perform the task.
To add a priority to a task, click on it to open it.
From the Priority section, select the one you want among the 4 proposed and it will appear on top:
- Urgent
- Important
- Medium
- Low

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Create a checklist for each task

The checklist allows you to create a "sub-tasks" list for each task. So if your task is a bit general, you can add other tasks related to it.
1. Open your task by clicking on it
2. Under checklist, add an item. Press Enter key to validate.
3. You can check the Show on card field to display the checklist directly on the board.
4. When a sub-task is done, just click on it !

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Add a comment in a task

Posting a comment on a task allows you to inform users about some specificities, to give your opinion, to provide additional information or to ask questions, ‚Ä¶

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Stay organized when planning your projects

Planner allows you to organize your team's work with an intuitive, collaborative and visual management of tasks.



Reorganize your tasks for simplified management

A reorganization of the plan display allows a quick and easy access to the various tasks.
In the Planner interface you will find :
-From Teams :
1.your plan
2.your tasks
3.the display mode
4.the filters
5.the task overview
Click here to see the video ‚èØ
-From Planner :
1.your plan
2.your tasks
3.the task overview
4.the members
5.the filters
6.the display mode



Modify your tasks display to read them more easily

At any times, follow the progress of your tasks in different views :
BOARD : The default view, you visualize your tasks in a table with different columns you can name and organize as you wish by adding buckets.
CHARTS* : You have here an overview of your tasks : progress of current tasks, distribution of tasks by buckets, number of tasks according to their priority as well as the distribution of tasks by members.
Note : You cannot extract the chart but if you need to use it in a presentation/report, we suggest you to make screenshots.
SCHEDULE : In this view, your tasks are integrated to a calendar. Change to a week view to see the entire name of the task. This tab allows you to see at a glance tasks in progress.
LIST** : this tab, available only in Teams, allows you to display a list of your tasks.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Show specific tasks

Find specific tasks, by using the Filter button in the menu.
You will be able to filter tasks regarding specific due date, priority, assignment to a specific person, et



Sort tasks into a bucket

Once your buckets have been added, sort your tasks into the buckets. To do this:
1.click on your task, in the opening window, at the top of the page, you have a Bucket field
2) Select the one of your choice, your task will automatically be stored in the chosen compartment

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Sort tasks by bucket

Change your plan organization by grouping your tasks according to several criteria :
- By Bucket
- Assigned to
- By progress
- By due date
- By labels
- By priority

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Access my assigned tasks

To quickly access your assigned tasks in the plan set,
1. open the Planner application from the Office365 portal, then
2.click on Assigned to me in the left menu
3. Here you will see all your tasks and their status
Note: the "Assigned to me" item groups the tasks created by you from Oulook or To Do, and the tasks that were assigned to you from Outlook by a colleague or from the different plans.



Tag a task as completed

Planner offers you the possibility to follow the progress of your tasks via the various statuses, to do so,
1. Click on the task
2 In "Progress" select the status of your task :
- Not started
- In progress
- Completed (to indicate that the task is finished)
You can also mark your tasks as completed by checking the box in front of the task name, it will then be closed and placed under the "Completed tasks"bucket,
To activate the task, you just have to click on it again



Go further on Planner

Discover the other features of Planner, and if you have any questions, do not hesitate to contact LEA365 and its online coach



Discover other Planner features

By accessing the advanced features of Planner you can :
-Use the different views
-Export the plan to Excel for more analysis
-Add a plan to the Outlook calendar
-Add a plan to favorites
-Access my tasks
-Delete a plan



Export a plan to Excel for further analysis

You can export a plan to Excel for further analysis. To do this, open your plan in the Planner app from the Office portal , then :
1. Click on the ... at the top of the page
2. Then on Export the plan to Excel
3. Find the file in your Downloads, it is named after your plan
In your spreadsheet, you will be able to customize your data, apply filters, add charts, use conditional formatting as you wish.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Import a plan to Outlook calendar

To add a plan to your Outlook display your task in your calendar:
1. From your plan in the planner app click on the ... at the top of the page
2. Choose Add plan to Outlook calendar
3. In the window that opens, check the second option Publish
4. Then click on Add to outlook
5. A window opens in your Outlook calendar, customize the display of your task in your calendar
6. You can add your plan to another calendar if you want
7. Finally click on Import

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Pin a plan to your favorites

If you are working on several projects, consider pinning important plans to favorites for quick access
Open the Planner application, then :
1.Click on Hub in the left menu
2.Open the All tab to see all the plans you have access to
3. Click on the icon that appears when you hover over the plan or the ... in front of the plan(s) you wish to bookmark
4. You can now easily access your favorite maps via the Pinned tab on the left



Delete a plan

When you no longer need a plan, you can delete it. To do this, open the plan you want to delete in the Planner application, then :
1. click on the plan's name at the top left
2) At the bottom of the window that opens, click on Delete this plan.
3) Check the box I agree that this plan and all its tasks will be permanently deleted.
Click on Delete.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



OneNote EN

OneNote is your digital Notepad, you can take notes easily, find them quickly and share them with one click with your internal or external contacts in your organization.
OneNote is part of the Office365 suite, you can access your notes from any device (PC, tablet, smartphone, ...).



OneNote is linked to Office, take advantage of it!

OneNote complements the Office suite very well and addresses specific needs that are not well served by other office tools. Moreover, the content of a OneNote page can be easily copied into these other programs and vice versa.



OneNote with Outlook

The OneNote application is linked to your Outlook email, take advantage of it through various features:



Identify to-do's and add them to your Outlook tasks

OneNote doesn't send a notification to remind you that you have tasks waiting to be processed. Nonetheless, thanks to OneNote's integration with Outlook, you can track certain tasks within Outlook.
Enter your text, select it then:
1. Click on Outlook Tasks in the ribbon
2. Choose a deadline for your task
3. As in Outlook, a follow-up indicator will appear in front of your text
4. The task is sent automatically in Outlook, to access it, click on the tasks icon at the left of your Outlook window

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Insert meeting details

Note-taking for a meeting report must meet a few requirements: note the date of the meeting, specify the participants, reiterate the objective.
Today you can import meeting details into your notebook with just a click!
Open a new page without renaming it, then:
1. Click on Meeting Details on the Home tab of the ribbon
2. Click on the arrow next to Choose a meeting from another day to find the date of the meeting
3. Click on the meeting and Insert details
4. All details will display on your page :
- The subject of the meeting which will be the name of the page
- The location , face-to-face or remotely, in this case you will see the Teams link
- The invitation message that you can expand with + to see the agenda
- The names of the participants you can expant with +
You can enter the notes of your meeting alone or with others, we are talking about co-editing . This is only possible when Notepad is shared.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Transform your notes into meeting report and send it by email

Meeting reports are shared either with people outside your team or organization, or with your team.
Therefore, you have on OneNote two possibilities to send your meeting notes:
- By email if participants are external to your organization
- If the exchange is internal : via a notepad shared with your team, in which you can add your notes. Your colleagues can access it at any time.
To send your report by mail:
1. Click on Email page on the Home tab of the ribbon
2. All information will be imported into a new email:
- The name of the OneNote page will be inserted as Subject of your email
- The meeting information will be inserted in the body of the text
- The participants will be added as main recipients
You can delete unnecessary information
3. Then, click on Send to send your email

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Link your notes to documents and internet researches

Linked notes allow you to dock OneNote on one side of your computer screen so you can see applications and websites on the other side. It's easier to take notes this way and you'll have the benefit of automatically linking your notes to what you're looking for.



Link your Word to your notes

Take notes as you normally would. During a linked note session, OneNote saves a thumbnail image of the page, an extract of the text, and a link to the Word documents used for the search, so you can return to the source content.
1. From your Word document, click on the Review tab
2. Then, click on Linked Notes
3. The active OneNote page will move to the side of your screen, a window will open with access to all of your notebooks, so you can stay on the active page or choose another page.
4. Start entering your notes, the open application icon is placed in front of the entered line. To open the documents linked to your notes, all you have to do is click on this icon.
5. A link symbol appears at the top right of the OneNote page to notify you that this page is linked to the open document.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Link your PowerPoint presentations to your notes

Take notes as you normally would. During a linked note session, OneNote saves a thumbnail image of the page, an extract of the text and a link to the powerpoint document(s) used for the research, so you can return to the source content.
1. From your PowerPoint presentation, click on the Review tab
2. Then, click on Linked Notes
3. The active OneNote page will move to the side of your screen, a window will open with access to all of your notebooks, so you can stay on the active page or choose another page.
4. Start entering your notes, the open application icon is placed in front of the entered line. To open the documents linked to your notes, all you have to do is click on this icon.
5. A link symbol appears at the top right of the OneNote page to notify you that this page is linked to the open document.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Link your notes to your web searches

You can link your notes to the content of a web page. This will help you to keep the sources.
Each time you copy an information from internet to a page of your notebook, you have a link to the web page below information pasted.
1. Open a OneNote page
2. Click on the View tab, then on Save to Desktop.
3. Find the web page you want
4. Start typing your notes, the Internet Explorer icon will appear in front of the text, and the notes will be automatically linked to the active web page

You can also copy the text from the web page and paste it into your notebook page, a link to the web page will be added automatically.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Collaborate on a shared Notebook

Take notes for yourself, or invite your colleagues to collaborate with you in a shared notepad. Together, you can track your teamwork, add text, images, files, and more.



Share your notebook

Share your notepad to facilitate exchanges within your team or with your external partners. It can meet various needs:
Centralize information around a project
Click on the File tab, then click on Share
Enter the names of the people with whom you want to share the document
Set the authorization level to Read or Edit
You can add a welcome message to your contacts
Validate by clicking on the Share button
You see the names of the people who access your notebook, at any time you can change the permissions or delete the share by right clicking on the contact
NOTE : If you have created a team on Teams, use the built-in application in Teams to create your notebook by clicking on the "+" symbol on the top bar, this will be shared automatically with the whole team.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Coedit a notebook

As soon as a notebook is shared, you can edit it in real time and simultaneously. You will see the modifications made by your colleagues at the same time:
You can display the initials of the authors of the modification, select the History tab and uncheck Hide the authors.
1.The initials of colleagues who made changes
2.To view the date of the changes, hover over the initials.
3.From the active window, you can get in touch with your colleague if she or he is available by launching an instant chat.

coeditonenote
Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Restore deleted notes

If you delete your note pages by mistake, you have up to 60 days to restore the deleted notes, after which they will be permanently deleted.
To restore your notes:
1.Click on the History tab
2.Select the Notepad bin.
3.Choose the page to restore, and click and drag it to the desired section
Click here to see the video ‚èØ



OneNote, for an efficient note taking

OneNote allows you to take efficient notes. You never run out of paper with notebooks. Notes are easy to organize, print and share, and you can search for important information quickly, even if you've forgotten where you originally captured it. Your notepads are stored online so you can easily access them on your mobile devices.



Organize your notebooGet familiar with the OneNote interface

Think of OneNote as a cabinet of binders (notebooks), with each binder containing pages separated by dividers.
You can organize your notepads as you wish: divide your notes into different tabs by topic (for example: one tab per project or per client) then by page (for example: by type of information).
1. Here will be displayed your notepads. At the beginning you will only have your own notebook and as you share you will see shared notebooks appear.
2. The sections are dividers, you can organize them as you wish: by subject, by project, ...
3. You can add as many pages as you want, by clicking on Add a page
4. To add a section click on the + symbol on the right and enter the name, then validate by pressing the Enter key on your keyboard

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Access your personal notebook

The first time you use it, notepad is created by default for you with your first name Firstname@Company Name. You can use this notepad or create a blank notepad.
1. From the File tab, click on New.
2. Choose the location of your Notepad and enter the name you want to give it,
3. Then click on Create.
4. OneNote displays the new notepad, which contains a new section and a new blank page

N.B: The pin allows you to pin Notepads in the left navigation pane



Optimizing your page display


To save time and be more efficient on OneNote, optimize the display of your interface. Thus you can choose to display the notepad, section and navigation panes page whenever you need them, and then hide them again when you're done and focus on your work.
1. To view your notepads, click the Show Notepad List arrow in the upper left corner
2. Then click on the pushpin button to pin the pane that displays the list of notepads.
3. Want to make the notepad space larger or smaller? Move the pointer to the vertical edge on the right of the navigation pane you want to resize.
4. When a double-headed arrow pointer appears, click and drag the edge of the pane to the left or right to free up the desired width, then release the mouse button.
5. If you want to display only your notes, click the Full Screen Mode arrow to optimize the display of your notes, To exit this mode, switch to Normal Mode.



Add a section

*Sections* are dividers, you can organize them as you wish: by subject, by project, .... However, you can create as many sections as you want.
1. To add a section click on the + symbol on the right, you can also use the keyboard shortcut Ctrl+T
2. Enter a name for the new section, then press Enter from your keyboard.
3. New sections always contain a new blank page. You can start taking notes on this page, create other pages

N.B.: OneNote offers you the possibility to move existing pages to other sections or other notepads with a simple click and drag**.



Add a page

To create additional pages in your notebook sections, follow these steps:
1. Click the tab of the section in which you want to add additional pages, and then do one of the following:
2. From the pane on the right, click +Add Page or use the keyboard shortcut Ctrl+N
3. Click on the line that appears above the creation date/time at the top of the page, enter the title and enter a description of the notes the page will contain.



Enter your notes

Take notes without constraints. In OneNote, every page is an infinite drawing area. Click and type wherever you want. Notes are containers that can be easily moved to wherever you want, allowing you to best organize your ideas.
Follow this module to learn the basics of OneNote. If you need help, don't hesitate to ask your LEA coach.



Create a note

Take notes without constraints and organize your ideas. OneNote can help you highlight, annotate and share your ideas the way you want.
To enter your text, you don't need to insert a text box, just click where you want your text to appear and start typing your notes.
To take typed or handwritten notes, do one of the following:
1. Click or tap on a location on the active page, then start typing.
2. To enter a page title, click or tap on the page header at the top of the page (above the date and time).
3. Click or tap another location on the page to start a new note, then start typing.



formatting your notes

For an optimal display of your text:
1. Select the text / or text area you want to format
2. In the Home tab, select the formatting you wish to apply (font, font size, bold, italic, underline, color, lists, indents, etc.).
3. If you change your mind, on any formatting you have applied, click or press the Cancel button at the top left of the application window.



Add tracking indicators to your notes

Indicators allow you to categorize, prioritize and quickly find your notes.
Organize your notes with the indicators to identify important or urgent notes.
Enter your text in multiple lines, then :
1.click on the down arrow from the Indicators group
2. on each line you can choose an indicator according to the importance of the information
3. You can create your own indicators, find out how in the following sequence:

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Create your own indicators

OneNote allows you to customize your indicators by creating your own tags:
1. From the Home tab, click on the bottom arrow (Others) to display the list of tags
2. Then click on Customize my tags.
3. A new window appears, click on New Tag.
4. Insert the full name of the tag, you can customize it by adding: (a symbol, a color or highlighting)
5. Then click on Ok, your new tag will be added to the list of indicators.



Insert content in your notebook

In OneNote, you can insert different types of information: links to a SharePoint site, a document, an image, etc.



Insert a link

To insert a link from a SharePoint site or an intranet into your notebook:
1.In OneNote, click on the Insert tab
2.Then click on the Link button
3.In the Address field, paste your link
4.In the Text to display field, customize the text you want to appear in your notepad page
5.Or choose to set a link to another page/notebook
6.Click on Ok
The custom link is now on the page.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Add a print to your page

To add a file as an attachment to your notepad:
1. click on the Insert tab in the ribbon
2) Then click on File Attachment.
3) Select the file in your file explorer
4) In the window that opens, select the Attach File option
5) The file is now attached to your page, double click on the file name to open it in the application and edit it.
Caution: When you add a file as an attachment or as a printout to a page in your notebook and edit it, it does not change the original file. This is because inserting the file into notepad creates a copy of the file.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Insert a document

To insert a document in your notepad you can insert a printout of the file, in this case you view the file directly in the page, you can also add the file as attachment.
To insert a printout of the file into your notepad:
1. Click on the Insert tab in the ribbon
2. Then click on Print file
3. Select the file in your file explorer
4. The contents of the file are displayed on your notebook page.
5. A shortcut to the file will appear at the top of the page, click it to open the file directly in the app.
NOTE : If you modify the content of the file, you will have to refresh the print by right clicking on the file name and selecting Update print

To add the file as an attachment in your notepad:
1. Click on the Insert tab in the ribbon
2. Then click on File Attachment
3. Select the file in your file explorer
4. In the window that opens, select the option Attach a file
5. The file is now attached to your page, double click on the file name to open it in the app and edit it.
NOTE: When you add a file as an attachment or as a print in a page in your notepad and edit it, it does not change the original file. This is because inserting the file into a notepad creates a copy of the file.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Insert an image

You can insert an image in several ways in your notebook:
- Insert a screenshot
- Insert a saved image
-I nsert an image online
To insert a screenshot in your notebook
1. Click on the Insert tab in the ribbon
2. Then, click on screen clipping in the Image group
3. Make the screenshot by selecting the content you want, the screenshot is automatically inserted into your page

To insert a already saved image into your notebook:
1. Click on the Insert tab in the ribbon
2. Then click on Pictures
3. Select an image in your file explorer by double clicking on in, the image appears in your notebook

1. To insert an online image into your notepad:
2. Click on the Insert tab in the ribbon
3. Then, click on Online images in the Images group
4. In the window that opens, enter your search in the search bar
5. Select the image you want to insert and click Insert at the bottom of the window
The image is now displayed in your notepad, you can change the size using your mouse

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Insert audio and video

In your notebook, you can insert a video or audio recording:
1. Click on the Insert tab in the ribbon
2. Then click on Record video or Record audio
3. Your recording begin, a new Recording tab appears with various options allowing you to edit your file.

You can also insert a video available on the internet:
1. In the Insert tab, click on Online Video
2. In the window that opens, paste the link of the video and click Ok to insert it into the page

NOTE: Remember to activate the keyword search in audio and video recordings.
To do this, click on the File tab> Options> Audio and video tab, under Audio search, check the box Enable word search in audio recordings and video and click Ok.
Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Create a Table

Like Word and PowerPoint, OneNote allows you to create tables, customize them from the contextual Table tab:
1. From the Insert tab, click on Table
2. Move the mouse pointer to the desired location to indicate the number of rows and columns.
3. Click on the last cell, your table will be inserted in your notes page
4. To customize it, use the commands in the Table tab



Insert a new Excel sheet

OneNote offers you the possibility to insert an Excel spreadsheet.
1. On the Insert tab, select Spreadsheet.
2. Click New Excel Spreadsheet again.
3. An Excel icon appears on the page, along with a static empty image of the worksheet.
4. To edit the worksheet, double-click the icon.



Import an existing Excel table

If you want to attach a chart or table to your meeting minutes, add the relevant sheet. This will add a copy of your sheet, in case of modification, the original document will not be impacted.
1. From the Insert tab, click on Spreadsheet.
2. Then click on Existing worksheet.
3. Locate the file you want to add, click on it, then select Insert.
4. Finally, click on Insert Spreadsheet.

**N.B.: the insertion of attachments in OneNote are copies, the original documents will not be impacted by the modifications made on them.



Search your notes instantly

Find your notes instantly, no matter where they are stored, with the Search



Search in OneNote

Thanks to the OneNote search engine, you can quickly find your notes, those entered by your colleagues, the modifications made by dates, by contacts, ... The search is done on the name or the content of your documents, images, ...
1. Click on the tab Search represented by a magnifying glass on the right
2. Enter your keyword in the search bar and press the Enter key
3. Choose the scope of your search
4. Pages containing your keyword are displayed



Search by indicators in OneNote

OneNote allows you to search by indicator, you can filter your search by (date, section, title, note text, ...)
1. Click on the Search tab represented by a magnifying glass on the left
2. Enter the name of your indicator in the search bar and press the Enter key
3. Select the Indicators tab
4. The pages containing your indicator are displayed



Find the last modifications made on OneNote

Find the changes recently made by you or your colleagues during your absence
1. In OneNote, pages recently modified by other users are marked as bold.
2. Click the Recent Changes button from the History tab
3. Refine your search and sort by date or location
4. In the pane on the right, view all recent changes made to your notebook



Find the authors of modifications

OneNote allows you to see who changed what in the notepad while you were away:
1. From the History tab, click on the Search by Author button
2. In the Search Result pane that appears on the right you see the list of authors with whom the notepad is shared
3. Sort your search by Author or by modification date



Outlook

Outlook is your email application.
You have many options to optimize your daily mail management and save time.
This application offers you large possibilities:
- Calendar management
- Tasks management
- Contacts management
- etc.



Communicate with your Outlook inbox

You spend 80% of your time dealing with incoming messages, LEA365 offers you tips and best practices to manage your mailbox without stress:
- Optimize your Outlook interface by changing the view
- Organize your emails to save time and efficiency
- Use Follow-up flags for important emails
- Categorize your emails to find them quickly
- Optimize the research of your emails
Depending on the license you have, you can use Outlook online or the desktop application called "heavy client"



Optimize Outlook interface

Outlook heavy client gives you access to an optimized and full version for PC and laptops.
You will be able to benefit all the advanced features of the tool:
- Automation of some actions to save time and productivity
- A powerful search engine to find any information
1. Header with a search engine integrated that allows you to find any information
2. The navigation pane to access your folders and all the Outlook items
3. Displays the content of the enabled element (mail, folder, deleted elements,...)
4. Reading pane

Click to read document üìñ



Change your Outlook display

To change the interface of your Outlook mailbox:
1. Click on the View tab in the header to access all options
2. Switch your display compact to single to sort your emails quicker depending on the contact, the subject, the importance, etc.
3. From the To-do bar, you can activate the calendar display, the contacts or the To-do to have quick access to current activities
4. Enable or disable the favorites folder by right-clicking on the mailbox folder and selecting Add to favorites or Delete from Favorites

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Configure reading pane

The reading pane allows you to view your emails without having to open them. To enable this pane:
1. Open the View tab in the menu
2. Click on the reading pane button in the Layout group
3. Select the location where you want to display the reading pane: right or bottom
4. Set the options of the pane by clicking on Options
5. Mark or unmark the boxes according to your needs
We advise you to unmark the box Mark item as read when selection changes so that you can manually switch your unread emails as read and miss any information.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Sort and filter columns for a quick management of the mails

To manage your mails quickly when you are on single view mode, you can sort or filter your columns:
1. Click on your column headers (from, subject, received...)
2. To overview your columns, click on the arrow and organise your columns as needed



Show emails as conversations

To activate the conversation mode:
1. Click on the View tab in the header
2. Mark the box Show as conversation
3. Apply to the folder Inbox or to all mailboxes
4. An arrow will appear on the left of the last mail to regroup mails that have the same subject. By clicking on the arrow, you can develop and reduce mails of the conversations.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Disable priority mailbox

The focused regroups important mails coming from a validated sources.
The other regroups mails: junk mail, ads,...
To enable or disable the "Focused" mailbox:
1. Open View tab
2. Click on Show focused inbox
3. The Focused and Other tabs disappear to show All and Unread, a display that leaves no room for surprises.

NB: Some emails can slide by mistake to the mailbox "Other", you can change the location by:
1. Right-clicking on the mail



Send an email

To send an email:
Send emails in Outlook heavy client
Sort automatically my mails in Outlook desktop



Rules of communication

Here some rules when you communicate by email:
1. Determine the recipients:
- In the to field, add only people involved by the subject
- in the Cc field, add people that will be copied of the mail and for whom it is useful to have the information
- In the Bcc field, add the people in secretly copy so they will not be visible by other recipients, very useful when sending mass mail to respect the confidentiality of everyone.
If the Bcc option is not available, click on the Options tab in your mail, then click on the Bcc button in the group Show fields.
The option will then appear on all your new mails and when you will reply.

2. The mail subject must be short, avoid sentences, prefer keywords that summarize your mail
3. Be clear in the mail body, avoid mails with more than 5 lines
4. If you change subject in the mail body or add a new subject, do not forget to change the subject of the email to inform the recipients.



Enable receipt for your important mails

You can enable the receipt for a specific important mail. This avoids receiving receipts for all your emails and being quickly overwhelmed by the number of notifications.
Click on the Options tab and mark the box receipt in the Follow up group.

If you want to receive a receipt for all your mails:
1. In your Outlook mailbox, click on File
2. Click on Options
3. In the window that just opened, go to the Mail tab
4. In the tracking group, mark the box Delivery receipt confirming the message was delivered to the recipient's email server
5. Click on OK to confirm. You will then receive a receipt for all your sent mails. You can unmark the box anytime so you won't receive receipt anymore.



Sort mails when sending them

Before sending your email, you can define the folder where it will be stored once sent.
To sort your email :
1. Click on the Options tab
2. Then click on Save sent item in in the More options group
3. Click on Other folder
4. Select the folder where you want to sort your mail in or click on New if you want to create a new folder to save the mail
5. Click on OK to confirm



Delay your mails delivery

When you've prepared an email (recipient, subject, mail's body) but you do not want to send it right now, you can plan the delivery of the mail:
1. Click on the Options tab
2. Click on Delay delivery in More options group
3. Define the delivery date and the time
4. Close and send your email
Be careful for this option to work and for your mail to be sent properly, Outlook must be open at the exact date and time you've delayed it.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Delegate the replies management to a contact

When you're sending an email, to delegate the replies management to a contact :
1. Click on the Options tab
2. Click on Direct replies To in More options group
3. Add contacts by clicking on the Select names button
4. Select contacts in the address book
5. Click on OK
6. Confirm by clicking on the Close button and Send the email



Add attachment

To add an attachment to an email:
1. Click on the Insert tab
2. Then on Attach File
3. Select the location of the file:
- Browse Web locations (SharePoint, OneDrive, Teams)
- PC, the sharing will be an attachment
When you want to attach a file stored on your PC, you can drag and drop it to be quicker.



Custom links before sending

When you add a link to a mail, they can be long, you can customize them in a few clicks:
1. In your mail, click on the Insert tab
2. Click on the link tab and on Insert link
3. In the window that just opened, paste your link in the Address field
4. Then customize the text to display in the field Text to display
5. Click on OK
6. The customized link is now inserted in your mail



Reply to an email

To reply to a mail, different options are available:



Reply with instant messaging

When interacting by email, you can switch to instant messaging to reply in a fluid and less formal manner on a subject:
1. Place your curser on the mail
2. In the Respond group, click on Reply with IM to include the recipient or Reply all with IM to include all people that received the mail.
3. Type your text in the Teams window that opens to interact
4. Click on Send



Reply to a mail with Teams call

When you receive an email, you may need to switch to a Teams call :
1. In then Reply group, click on Call
2. Choose if you want to call only the expeditor or all recipients.
3. Teams call window opens, you can then chat with your colleagues



Forward an attachment

If you want to reply to a mail by including one or more attachment:
1. Place you on the mail to forward
2. Click on the Forward button
3. You will find the attachment in your mail, add a recipient, then send.



Forward email as attachment

You can turn a mail into an attachment and forward it to your contacts:
1. Go on the mail
2. In the Respond group, click on More respond actions then on Forward as attachment
3. Your mail is now an attachment, you can complete (recipient, body, etc.) and send it.



Turn email into a meeting

When you receive an email and you need to discuss more on a subject, you can turn an email into a meeting:
1. Place you on the mail
2. Click on the Reply with meeting button in the Respond group
3. The meeting opens, modify the time and add informations if needed.
Be Careful the invitation is sent to all cotacts that received the mail: priority reciprients and people in copy of the mail. You can delete contacts if you do not want to invite everybody to the meeting.
4. Click on Send to send the invitations to your contact(s). They will receive automatically a notification by email to be informed on this meeting, then they could accept it, refuse or suggest another time.



Organize your Outlook folders

Organize your folders in Outlook:
- by using the rules to sort your messages quickly
- by creating folders to sort your important mails



Use rules to file quickly your messages

The rules allow you to automate some actions for incoming or outgoing messages, for example: move incoming emails from some contacts into a folder to automatically file them upon receipt.
To create a rule:
1. Go to the mail in question
2. From the Home tab, click on Rules in the group Move
3. Then click on Create rule...
4. In the window that opens, tick the box From
5. Then tick the Move the item to folder box
6. Select New if the folder doesn't exist -you can create it when creating the rule- or select an existant folder
7. If you've created a new folder, name it and confirm
Henceforth, all the received mails from this contact will move automatically into the specific folder.
To access to your rules: click on Rules in the header, then on Manage Rules and Alerts. You can change or delete them at anytime.
There are several rules to automatize your actions. Be careful not to create too many of them, so you won't be confused while managing your mails.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ
Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Create folders to file your important mails

You can create folders under your mailbox to file your important mails.
To create a folder in Outlook:
1. Right click on your mailbox
2. Click on New Folder
3. Name it and click on Enter or OK

NB.: Outlook offers plenty of search tools to find your mails quickly, you don't need to file them into folders and subfolders.
Ask the BOT the following question "Find a mail quickly"
To move an email to a folder:
1. Select the mail
2. Drag and drop it to the folder of your choice



Optimize the window of a mail

When you reply to a mail, for more understanding and visibility to write your mail, you can isolate it in another window:
1. Click on the Reply or Reply all button at the top right of the mail you want to isolate
2. Click on Pop-out
3. The mail opens bigger in another window



Manage your Outlook calendar as a pro

In Outlook online you will have access to a calendar allowing you to organize and manage your appointments as you wish. You can also access and view all your colleagues' calendars and share your own in 2 clicks.



Organize your Outlook calendar

Let's discover together how to plan, and manage your calendar com



Optimize calendar display

Custom your calendar View for a better visibility:
1. Click on the Calendar tab on the bottom left
2. Select a view in the Arrange group
- Day
- Work Week
- Week
- Month



Arrange an appointment or a meeting

Create an appointment in your calendar:
1. Go on your Outlook calendar
2. Click New appontment in the New group
3. Add a title to your appointment
4. Setup the date and the time of your appointment
5. Add a location if needed
6. Put a reminder
7. When you invite participants, the appointment turns automatically into a meeting
8. In case of unavailability, Outlook suggests time slots when every participant are available
9. At anytime you can turn your appointment into a Teams meeting by clicking on the Teams meeting button in the header. This will automatically generate a link to connect to the meeting.
10. Save

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Book a room

When you create a meeting, you can Select Rooms among those available only if this option is enabled in your company:
1. In your calendar, click on New Appointment or New Meeting if you want to add contacts
2. Click on the Location button
3. Select the meeting room in the list by double-clicking on it to add it into the field Rooms then click on OK
4. Your room is now booked.
Complete other fields if needed and send the invitation. The participants will receive the informations in the invitation for the meeting.



Use color categories to differentiate an appointment

You can track all items related to a particular project or task using color categories to identify and organize items easily. In addition to calendar items, you can assign color categories to contacts, messages, tasks, notes and journal items.
This organization will allow you to differentiate your internal to your external appointments.
To do so:
1. Right click on the appointment or click on new email
2. Click on "categorize" tab, select the desired color in the the color you want in the list
3. Specify a color in the submenu



Give access to your calendar for more visibility

To share your calendar with your collegues so that they can have more visibility on your schedule:
1. Right click on your calendar
2. Click on Sharing permissions
3. In the window that just opened, click on Add
4. Select a contact in the address book by double clicking on this contact to add it and click on OK
5. Define the sharing permissions
6. Then Click on Apply
Your collegue receive automatically a notification by email to inform them, now they can see your calendar.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Save 1 hour a day on your mails managment

You want to save 1 hour a day on your mails managment. You can then optimize you Outlook interface, read your mails by a few clicks, highlight your important mails, organize you mail to save time and be more efficient, as for tips and good practices to know.



Manage your incoming mails in a few clicks

You can save 1 hour a day on your mails managment by using these different options: follow-up indicators, categories, etc.



Follow-up mails

Use follow-up indicators to deal with your urgent or important mails.
1. Click on the Flag that appears on the right, your mail is now added to the To-do list
2. To add a follow-up to a future date, right click on the flag and select a date. To add a specific date, click on Custom...
3. You can add a reminder to be informed of the specified date and hour.
To access all your follow-up mails, you have two options:
4. Click on the View tab > Task bar > Task: a window will open on the right of your mails with your tasks
5. Click on the Task tab on the bottom left of the Outlook interface to display your tasks on one single window

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Categorize your emails

The categories allow you to find a mail easily according to the subject, the sender, a keyword, etc.
No more filing your mails to folders, a simple research by category, allow you to find all the tagged mail.
To categorize your mails:
1. Right click on the mail
2. Click on Categorize
3. Select All categories
4. Rename categories of current colors. You can also create new categories by clicking on the New button.
5. Click on OK
The category appears now on your mail. When you place your curser on the search bar, you can find all categories by clicking on the Categorize button, select a category to display assigned mails.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Use quick steps

Quick steps allow you to automate some current steps in one click. Henceforth, unlike rules, you have to enable the steps manually.
As quick step, you can for example forward important mails to your manager.
To create a quick step:
1. Select your mail
2. From the Home tab, click on Quick steps
3. Then on New quick step and on Custom...
4. Select a step, for example Forward
5. Define the settings of the step. Here we're going to forward mails to a recipient by clicking on the field To and by selecting the contact into the address book
6. You can even add a keyboard shortcut that will enable the step
7. Rename your quick step
8. Click on Finish, the step is now available, simply click on it to enable it

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Use quick parts to insert text block

The QuickParts allow you to save time by creating blocks with reusable informations for recurring messages: mails templates with text, board, etc.
1. From a new mail, type your text and select it
2. Click on the Insert tab
3. Click on Quick Parts in the Text group
4. Save your text to Quick Part gallery
5. Rename your block with a precise name and confirm
6. To use your Quick Part: type the name you gave to your block and type ENTER to insert it.
NB: To insert your text in a new mail the first time, type the name and click on F3, Outlook will memorize the name and will suggest it the following times.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Use templates for your recurring mails

The templates allow you to save a recurring text so you can reuse it later.
1. From a new mail, in the Message tab, in the group My templates, click on the View templates button
2. Click on + Template to create a new design
3. Define a title
4. Add your text
5. Click on Save
6. Click on your template to add it in the mail body and then save time

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Tips and good practices

A set of behaviors considered essential and which allow a better use of the uses. You become more efficient in your work and organization.



Add a conditional formatting

Conditional formatting highlights important messages upon receipt that respond to criteria, defined by the user, by using specified colors, fonts and styles.
For example: all mails received by my manager have to be in green color, bold and italic.
To add a conditional formatting:
1. Open the View tab
2. Click on View settings
3. Then click on conditional formatting
4. In the window that just opened, add a new conditional formatting
5. Type the Name and define the Font...
6. Click on Condition...
7. Define conditions of your conditional formatting: name of the sender, name of the recipient, where my name appears, etc.
8. Click on OK
The formatting will now apply on mails you receive according to the conditions you've applied.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Add or edit a signature

Delete redundant mails
You can delete all redundant mails of a conversation in a few clicks:
1. Place your curser on the conversation
2. Click on the Clean Up button in the Delete group
3. Click on Clean Up conversation
4. In the pop-up, click on Clean Up to delete redundant messages from the conversation and keep only one that will regroup all your interactions.



Schedule an Out of Office message

You can create one or several custom signatures for your emails:
1. Open a new mail
2. In the group Include, click on Signature
3. Then Signatures...
4. In the window that just opened, click on New
5. Assign a name to it and click on OK to confirm
6. In the field Edit signature, type the text for your signature and add images and any information that will be useful in your signature.
7. Set up your signature so it will appear in every New mail, for example you can create another one for transfers and replies. If you have several email addresses, you can create a different signature for every address.



Use scheduling assistant to see the availabilities of your collegues

When you schedule a meeting, you have access to the Scheduling Assistant on top in the header, it allows you to see the availabilities of your collegues even if they didn't share their calendar with you. This avoids having hard time to find a time slot that fits all schedules.
Don't forget to click on the scheduling assistant before sending your invitation.



OneDrive your personal and business file storage space

OneDrive is your personal and business file storage space, no one has access to this space. However, you can share some documents with 2 or 3 people in your organization.
OneDrive is great for storing any file format up to 100 GB.
Click to read document üìñ
Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Discover OneDrive

OneDrive is a tool that stores files for personal use in the company but also to share them with collegues.



Connect to OneDrive

You can access your OneDrive from any hardware! You just need to use an internet browser and identify yourself with Your email address and your password
OneDrive is accessible in mobility, You just have to download the app from the App Store, Android, ...



From a computer

Access the OneDrive app on the Office 365 portal from an internet browser.

NB : Do not hesitate to add the link as favorite or put a shortcut on your desktop for quick access.



From a smartphone / tablet

You can download the OneDrive application (available on iOS, Android, Windows Phone) on your phone or tablet
Then enter your email address and your session password



Is it possible to have several OneDrive accounts ?

An account is linked to an email address. If you have more than one Microsoft email address, you can access to OneDrive by using up to 9 work or school accounts, and 1 personal OneDrive account.



Change theme

You can change the color theme of your OneDrive:
1. Click on the settings cogwheel at the top right
2. Then, click on "View all"
3. By clicking on "View all" under the **Themes * block, you can see all the themes offered by Microsoft
4. Click on the one you want to use.



Change language

You can change the language of your interface:
1. Click on the settings cogwheel at the top right
2. Click on View all
3. Click on Change your language
4. A new page opens, click on change display language
5. Choose your language



Discover the OneDrive environment

In your OneDrive homepage you can find the:
1. Navigation panel, gives you access to: your files, shared files or recently opened, the recycle bin and an access to different shared libraries
2. Horizontal menu, gives you access to different options linked to your file space
3. Search bar allows you to find a file/folder stored in your OneDrive space
4. scerw wheel allows you to customize your OneDrive space



Horizontal menu

In the horizontal menu you will find:
- New : allows you to create new Office files, folders, forms, links, ...
- Upload : allows you to upload existant files from your computer
- Synchronize : once synchronization has started, allows you to access documents from files explorer
- Automatize : allows you to set up automated actions via the Power Automate tool, such as validation workflows
- Sort: allows you to change the sorting of "your files"
- Display otpions : allows you to change the display of your files
- Informations panel : summary of your latest activities related to your files stored in OneDrive (create, edit, delete)



Search bar

OneDrive allows you to find a document thanks to filters :
- All files
- My files
- Organisation



Files access

This is your own online private space to store professional documents.



Access recent folders

The Recent tab groups the last files you have opened or edited.



Access shared files

The Shared tab groups :
- The documents that have been shared with you, you will find at the top the popular documents. This space is customizable, you can sort your columns or group the documents according to "author, date, or activity"
- The documents you have shared, this space is not customizable, it is a display by default of all the documents you have shared.



Access deleted files from recycle bin

You will find all the deleted documents/folders in the recycle bin. They are saved for up to 3 months, you can restore them at any moment.
After this period, you will have to contact your IT department.

Learn more about restoration :



Access other shared libraries

From OneDrive, you do not need to return to the homepage of the Office365 portal, to access documents stored in collaborative spaces Teams or SharePoint.
Indeed, you have a quick navigation, so you will find the shared libraries under the left menu.



Add and create files

You can create Office documents directly from OneDrive, the documents remain accessible anywhere and anytime!



Create folders in OneDrive

Create a folder in OneDrive :
1; On the OneDrive homepage, go to the "My files" tab
2. Click on the "New" button in the horizontal menu
3. Select "Folder"
4. Name the folder
5. Click on "Create"



Create a document from OneDrive

You can create Office documents from OneDrive :
1. Select New, then choose what type of document you want to create.
2. The new document opens in the web application you selected.
3. To rename the document, click on name in the title bar, type the desired name.
4. Choose a location to save your file, then click on Enter.
No need to save, it is saved automatically.



Save a document in OneDrive from Office

You can save your documents in OneDrive from an Office application :
1. Click on your Office desktop application and open a new Word, PowerPoint, or Excel document
2. Click on Folder then Save As
3. In OneDrive-name, enter the name of the folder and choose its layout,
4. Select Save



Upload an existant document

To share your documents, drop them in OneDrive by clicking on Upload :
1. On OneDrive homepage, go to the Horizontal Menu
2. Click on the Upload button
3. Select Files or Folder
4. Select and click on Open



Duplicate a document in OneDrive

To duplicate a document from your OneDrive :
1. Click on ¬∞¬∞¬∞ in front of the file to duplicate
2. Click on the "Copy to"
3. Select the destination "Your OneDrive"
4. Select the folder where you want to duplicate your file
5. Click on "Copy here"



Co-edit the same document in real-time

By using OneDrive, you can work together on a Word document, an Excel worksheet or a PowerPoint presentation, you will visualise simultaneously your collegues changes.
Other advantages :
- The documents are still available even when they are opened by your collegues
- A single version of the document is saved
- No more sending attachments and consolidating all changes
- You can edit your document from any device : Computer, Tablet, Smartphone.
All you have to do is :
1. Open the document
2. If another person works on the document, you will see their presence information and the changes they made.



Move your files from one folder to another

To move a document from one folder to another :
1. Click on ¬∞¬∞¬∞ in front of the file to move
2. Click on the "Move" button
3. Select the destination "Your OneDrive"
4. Select the folder where you want to move your file
5. Click on "Move here"



Move a document from your OneDrive to a SharePoint library

When you want to share files with a different team, or even assign ownership to other teams, you can move files and folders from OneDrive to SharePoint :
1. Click on "¬∞¬∞¬∞" in front of the file to move
2. Click on the Move button
3. Select the destination You OneDrive
4. Select the Teams team / the SharePoint library of your choice
5. Click on Move here



Manage your documents from OneDrive

OneDrive allows you to store personal and professional documents. You can create, share, edit, move your documents safely.



Edit a document

You can edit a document stored in OneDrive from :
- Your OneDrive space online,
- or in the local OneDrive application.
The document is saved automatically as you edit it.



From a browser

To edit a document from a browser :
1. Click on ¬∞¬∞¬∞ in front of a document
2. Click on the "Open" button in the horizontal menu
3. Select the option "Open in a browser"
4. No saving will be requested, it is enabled automatically by default



From a desktop

To edit a document from a desktop application :
1. Click on ¬∞¬∞¬∞ in front of the document
2. Click on the "Open" button in the horizontal menu
3. Select the option "Open in the application"



Delete a OneDrive document

To delete a document :
1. Click on ¬∞¬∞¬∞ in front of the file to delete
2. Click on "Delete"
3. Select "Delete" to confirm the deletion of the file



Restore a deleted document

If you have deleted a file by mistake you can restore it directly from the recycle bin of OneDrive.
1. Click on the "recycle bin" tab in the left pane
2. Select the file to restore
3. Click on the "Restore" button in the horizontal menu
4. You will find your document at its initial place
NB: The files are stocked in the OneDrive rcycle bin for 93 days after being deleted from their original location.



Share OneDrive files

The OneDrive space is specific to each user, the files and folders you store are private, but you can share them with others at anytime. There are several ways to share documents on OneDrive :
1. Click on the share icon
2. Choose which person you want the share link works for
3. Authorize or not the document edition
4. Click on Apply
