5. Add the persons with whom you want to share the document then add a message.
6. Click on Copy link to send a link or Outlook to send the document attached by email
7. Click on Send



Request access to a document from OneDrive

You can now request access to a file from your collaborator by sending a message or a direct link containing the file name on OneDrive.
1. Click on the "..." in front of the folder
2. Select Request files
3. Enter the file name you want and click on Next
4. A tab for sending the request is displayed, it allows you to either Copy the link or Send it by email
5. Click on Ok



Go further on OneDrive uses

&&&&&&&&



Access your documents in synchronization mode

OneDrive online allows you to access your files from any browser. However, in case your network goes down, you won't be able to access your files.
Synchronize OneDrive and access your files even offline.

To learn more :
Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Launch OneDrive synchronization

Synchronize your OneDrive space and access your documents from the files explorer:
Click on the Synchronize button in the horizontal menu
A new window opens Synchronization in progress
Synchronization is launched, a OneDrive tab now appears in your files explorer.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Track the status of my files from my explorer

In your files explorer, to check the synchronization of your files, you have a status column:
- Cloud icon with white background: documents are accessible only from the cloud and require an internet connection.
- Icon with green check mark: documents are accessible in local or from the cloud
- Icon with two arrows: indicates the synchronization is in progress
- Icon with green background and white check mark: these files are stored on your hard disk drive, they are always accessible even offline.
- Cloud icon with man: indicates the file or the folder has been shared with other persons.
- The glimmers: indicate a new file. You will only see that while using OneDrive online.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Handle synchronization errors

Your files do not synchronize or synchronize too slowly from your computer to OneDrive, consider:
Check the files size: respect the limits defined for all files (up to 50GB)
Check files names: Some caracters in a file name are not supported in OneDrive. Please avoid these to prevent all synchronization problems.
Reset the synchronization connection: You can often resolve problems of synchronization by restoring you synchronization connection.
Stop and restart synchronization: You can stop the synchronization and reboot to resolve prblems linked to the synchronization folder.



Free up OneDrive space on my PC

All the documents synchronized on your computer occupy the hard disk drive, it is preferable to synchronize only the documents you need:
1. Click right on the file
2. Select the Free up space option
3. Your document will be accessible only with a connection, it will not take up space on your PC.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Synchronize a SharePoint library

From the "Files " tab of a Teams team, select the "Open in SharePoint" option in the top ribbon.
1. Click on "Documents" or access the under-file to synchronize.
2. Click on the "Synchronize" button.
This operation is done only once, then the synchronization is done automatically.
Click here to see the video ‚èØ

Notes: Your most recent conversations and those you have pinned remain available offline.



Security

With Office365, the access to your documents is secure. However, please never share your credentials to others.
Follow your organization's security guidelines.



Who can access my OneDrive?

The OneDrive space is specific to each user, you are the only one to access this space. You are the sole owner.



What happen to my documents when I leave the company?

If you leave the company, your collegues will not have access to the files. Before you leave the company, please transfer the relevant files.



Folders are created by default in my OneDrive, what are they ?

Some folders are created automatically in OneDrive. These folders are linked either:
- to your Outlook inbox: the saved attached files
- to the synchronization of the files explorer
- to Teams conversations files
- to My pictures: screenshots, saved images
- Office Lens: the scanned documents from your phone
- etc.

Transf√©rer un mail en tant que pi√®ce jointe depuis OWA

Vous pouvez transformer un mail en pi√®ce jointe et le transf√©rer √† vos contacts :
1.Placez-vous sur le mail

Partager ou d√©l√©guer ?

Une boite partag√©e ou boite commune est une boite mail accessible par plusieurs collaborateurs, en g√©n√©ral d'un m√™me service. Cette boite est par exemple une adresse, connue des utilisateurs externes, qui va √™tre utilis√©e pour √©changer avec le service. Par cons√©quent, le personnel du service va pouvoir avoir des actions sur cette boite.
Il est possible de partager quelques √©l√©ments de sa boite mails. Par exemple, vous souhaitez donner une plus grande visibilit√© √† un coll√®gue sur votre calendrier. Vous allez alors partager votre calendrier !
Une boite d√©l√©gu√©e est une boite mail, dont le propri√©taire d√©l√®gue certaines actions √† une autre. C'est par exemple le cas d'un manager qui va d√©l√©guer sa boite mail √† son assistante.

- modification, pour cr√©er ou modifier ou consulter ces informations

Il est ainsi possible de savoir qui fait quoi
Pour suivre l'avancement, il est possible d'utiliser les drapeaux. Un drapeau ouvert, le mail est en court de traitement. Une case coch√©e, le mail est trait√©

Partager votre boite de r√©ception

Pour partager votre boite de r√©ception :
- Faite un clic-droit sur votre boite de r√©ception
-Ouvrer le menu Autorisations
-Ajouter les droits √† la personne de votre choix
Vous devez faire attention aux droits que vous donner.
Des droits en lecture, permettront √† l'utilisateur de lire tous les mails de votre boite de r√©ception.
Des droits en modification permettront √† l'utilisateur de lire et de supprimer les mails de votre boite de r√©ception.



Consulter un calendrier

Pour consulter un calendrier, basculer sur la fen√™tre de votre calendrier.
Cocher la case correspondant au calendrier que vous souhaitez voir

Le calendrier s'ouvre dans la zone de visualisation



Share

Today, thanks to Office 365, wherever you are, you can share your work documents, edit them in real time and find them quickly. Documents remain accessible from any device.
Here are some tips and best practices to be more efficient with Office 365 !
> You must save professional private documents that you do not want to share on your OneDrive space
> If you want to share a document with your colleagues only, drop it in the dedicated Teams team space, it will only be accessible by members of this team
- Documents remain available even when they are opened by other colleagues
- You see in real time the modifications of other colleagues
- A single version of the document is saved
- No more sending enclosed documents by email to then consolidate all changes
- You can edit your document from any device PC, Tablet, Smartphone
- You want to share your document with a larger team. Drop it in a dedicated SharePoint space, or in a Yammer (intranet).
- Synchronize your document library to keep your documents accessible when you are working offline
- For better organization, name correctly and remember to categorize your documents to find them quickly
- Use Teams for your team communications
- Use instant messaging for your informal communications
- Download your useful applications on your mobiles to access your work environment more quickly



Share a document

No matters the app you are in (OneDrive or SharePoint), to share a document :
1. Open it and click on Share button at the top right
2. Choose permission by clicking on the default permission
- Anyone with the link : less recommended because as anyone with the link could access the document, so if the recipient forward the link to another person, she would be able to access your document without your consent.
- People in the organization with the link :All employees will have access to the document with this link. Be careful with sensitive documents, a sharing link can be forwarder !
- People with existing access : Use this option if you just want to send a link to someone who already has access to the document.
- Specific people : Grant access to only the people you specify. It is the most recommended for sensitive documents because even if the link is forwarded, only people who are mentioned here will have access to the document. Use this permission to share a document with a recipient out of your organization.
3. Choose here if you want to Allow editing or not. If you decide to share the document reading only you can decide to Block download
4. Apply
5. Enter your contacts name or email addresses
6. Send
Recipicents will receive a link by email.
NOTE : You can also copy the sharing link to paste it in a document for instance.
WARNING : Before sharing a document, make sure that :
1. The document is not confidential
2. External sharing is allowed by your company



Set a password on a shared document

This option is only enabled on OneDrive. You can safely share your work by defining a password to access it.
1. In the link settings* window when you share a document, set password.

WARNING** : you will need to send the password to the recipients.



Collaborate on shared documents

As soon as a document is stored in a shared space (Teams or Sharepoint) , it is shared with all members of that space.
You can therefore edit it simultaneously with your colleagues. We call it co-editing.
Benefits :
- Documents remain available even when they are opened by an other person.
- You see modifications in real time.
- A single version of the document is saved, but you can restore an older version by yourself.
- Finish sending enclosed documents by email and consolidating all modifications.
- You can edit your document from any device : PC, tablet, smartphone.
To edit a document :
1. Right click on the document
2. Choose Open
3. Select the app with which you want to open the document.



Be informed when a document has been modified

Set up an alert on a document allows you to receive an email each time there is a modification.
To avoid receiving too much email, it is important to use alerts with parsimony.
1. Right click on the document or folder you want to follow-up
2. Choose alert me
3. Customize your alert in the windows that opens and click OK.

NOTE : to set an alert on a Teams document, you must open it in SharePoint first.



Manage my alerts

To edit or delete an alert on a document, you should be in the documents library of your document.
1. In the options bar, click on ... and on Manage my alerts
2. Select the alert you want to delete (or just open it if you want to edit)
3. Delete selected alerts



Version history of a document

With Office 365 you don't have to save a new document for each version of it.
Indeed, every modification is kept in memory thanks to version history and you can decide to access, edit, delete or restore it at any time.
1. Right click on your document
2. Choose version history
3. Click on the arrow in front of the version you want to access and choose the action (View, Restore or Delete).

NOTE : Office 365 keep until 500 versions for each document.



Sharing modes

Several sharing solutions are available to you:
-From Office tools
-From an Outlook email
-From a Yammer community
-With an Office group
NB: You can even set an expiration date for your sharing link



Share a document with Outlook

Share directly a document by email :
1. From the new message, click on Attach file.
2. Two options are available
- Attach the item as a classic enclosed document (Attach item or Browse this PC)
- Link the item : your document must be stored in the cloud (Browse web locations)
3. Recent items allow you to quickly find your recently used documents. Those with a cloud icon are stored on the cloud and could be shared as a link.
WARNING : The default permission here will allow editing, you can change the permission level by clicking on the small arrow down to the document once is attach to the message.



Share a document in Yammer

To share a document through a Yammer feed :
1. On the new message, click on the upload icon to choose a file on your computer or the SharePoint icon to upload a file from the cloud.
2. Choose the document you want to share and click Open
3. Post



Share a document with an Office 365 group

To share a document with a group, simply enter the name of the Office 365 group in the recipients field.
Make sure you are sharing the correct document and that you have correctly defined the authorisation level.



Set an expiration date on a shared document

This option is only enabled on OneDrive. You can safely share your work for a limited time.
1. In the link settings* window when you share a document, set expiration date**



Edit permissions of a document

Once you have shared a document, you can change the access rights at anytime.
1. Right click on the document and choose Manage access
2. On the Manage Access pane, click on Stop sharing to delete all access.
3. Otherwise, you can also click on the ... in front of a sharing link to edit permission.
4. Or click on the arrow to delete only desired access.



Share a SharePoint Site

To give access to a SharePoint site you must be Owner or Admin of this site.
1. In your SharePoint site, click on Share button at the top right
2. Enter your contact name or email address
3. Click on Show options to change permission level
4. Share

NOTE : We do not recommend to share a specific document/folder inside a SharePoint to avoid complicate rights management.



Share a document library

If you are the site owner you can decide to grant access to only a document library of your SharePoint site. You must before stop rights inheritance for this library to grant unique access.
1. Open the document library and click on the settings icon at the top right
2. Choose Library settings
3. Click on Permissions for this document library
4. Click on Stop inheriting permissions
5. Click on Grant permissions
6. Enter name, show options to configure permissions and Share



Stop sharing a document library

If you have granted unique permissions for a library, you can remove it anytime :
1. From the document library, click on Settings icon at the top right
2. Choose Library settings
3. Choose Permissions for this document library
4. Check the member you want to delete
5. Click on Remove user permissions



Share a folder

To share a folder from OneDrive or SharePoint :
1. Right click on the folder and choose Share
2. Choose permission by clicking on the default permission.
3. Choose here if you want to Allow editing or not. If you decide to share the document reading only you can decide to Block download
- Anyone with the link : less recommended because as anyone with the link could access the document, so if the recipient forward the link to another person, she would be able to access your document without your consent.
- People in the organization with the link :All employees will have access to the document with this link. Be careful with sensitive documents, a sharring link can be forwarder !
- People with existing access : Use this option if you just want to send a link to someone who already has access to the document.
- Specific people : Grant access to only the people you specify. It is the most recommended for sensitive documents because even if the link is forwarded, only people who are mentioned here will have access to the document. Use this permission to share a document with a recipient out of your organization
4. Choose here if you want to Allow editing or not. If you decide to share the document reading only you can decide to Block download.
5. Apply
6. Enter your contacts name or email addresses
7. Send

NOTE : You can also copy the sharing link to paste it in a document for instance.
WARNING : When you share a folder, you share everything that is inside it !
Before sharing a folder with your internal or external contacts :
1. Make sure you are sharing the correct folder
2. There are no sensitive documents in the folder
3. External sharing is allowed by your organization



Stop sharing a SharePoint site

To remove a member of a SharePoint site you must be owner of the site :
1. From the site, click on Settings icon at the top right
2. Choose Site settings
3. Choose Site permissions
4. Choose the permission group where the member is
5. Check the member you want to delete
6. Click on Actions and Remove Users from Group

#alternatives
Delete a member on sharepoint



Share documents in Teams

By default, all documents your upload in a Teams are accesible to all members of this Team.
As Teams is a collaborative app, they will be able to edit the document.
We do not recommend to share a specific document/folder inside a team to avoid complicate rights management.
To know more, ask me How to manage teams members.



Share a form

You can share your form in different ways via the Share button at the top right.
It is possible to share a form in order to collect responses internally or outside your organization, even if the participants do not have an Office 365 license. But it is also possible to share a form with collaborators in order to co-edit this one. You will notice that there are several sharing options in order to best meet your need. You will be able to send the form by email, share it via a link, but also export it as a QR code or even integrate it directly into a web page.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Collect responses in the organization

By default, when you click on the Share button, the Only people in my organization can respond option is selected. Thus the form will be accessible only by your colleagues.
But be careful, this also means that all members of your organization can access your form. In order to restrict access you can:
1. Click on Share
2. Click the arrow to the right of the sharing permission, and select Specific people in my organization can respond.
3. You will need to enter the name or email address of your colleagues here.
4. Finally, select the most suitable sharing option (Link, QR code, Embed or Email)

Click here to see the video ‚èØ
# alternatives #
Share a survey internally
Share a survey with colleagues



Collect responses outside the organization

By default, when you click on the Share button, the Only members in my organization can respond option is selected. Thus the form will be accessible only internally. If you want to share the form with people outside your organization:
1. CLick on Share
2. Click on the arrow to the right of this authorization
3. Then, select the option Anyone can reply.
4. Finally, select the most suitable sharing option (Link, QR code, Embed or Email)

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Sharing options

You have 4 options to share your form when you click on the Share button at the top right of the page:
- Share via a link (1): copy the link and paste it wherever you want: in a Teams conversation, on a presentation, on a site, etc.
- Share via a QR code (4): by scanning the QR code with a phone, respondents will directly access the survey to respond to it.
- Share via an integration code (3): if you want to integrate the form into a website, generate an html code and integrate it into your site.
- Share directly by email (2): by clicking on the icon, a new Outlook email opens, complete the email (recipient, body of the email) and send it.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Share to collaborate

If a colleague does not have access to the survey and you want him to edit it with you, share it with him to collaborate :
1.Click on the Share button at the top right
2.In the Share to collaborate field in the window that opens, click Get a link to view and edit
3.The default share permission is Users with an Office 365 work or school account can view and edit. Click the arrow to the right to restrict this permission to members of your organization or to specific users only.
3.Then copy the link and send it to your colleague (s) so that they can edit the survey.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Get email notification for each response

If you need to follow the progress of responses to your survey, you can receive an email notification for each new response.
1. Click on the ... at the top right of the page and on Settings.
2. At the bottom of the window that opens, you have a field Response receipts, check the box Get email notification for each response.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Excel 2019

Excel is an application of the Microsoft Office, it is based on logical mathematics, it integrates the following functionalities:
- Numerical calculation with multiple calculation functions (arithmetic operator, statistics, search functions...) accessible from the Formulas tab.
- Graphical representation to visualize your data in the form of histogram, sectors,...
- Simplified analysis of your data: Dynamic table, Pivot table...
- Automation of actions with simple macros.
Each Excel file corresponds to a workbook, which contains worksheets organized in rows and columns, the intersection of the two represents a cell reference example: A1, B1,...



Excel, the fundamentals

Excel has the same basic interface as Word, the ribbon is in the same place but instead of a white sheet is a large empty table.
Often Excel tables represent daily, weekly, monthly or yearly data. Instead of creating an Excel file per time interval, tabs have been set up at the bottom of the screen.
You can therefore create as many as you want, for example a tab for each month of the year, and duplicate your January table on the other months.



Some vocabulary

A spreadsheet is a software for processing information in tabular form. Data is placed in cells that can then be processed using mathematical formulas that can range from simple addition to consolidation of more complex data.
In this module, you will discover the Excel interface and the associated vocabulary
- A workbook is the file with the "xlsx" extension; It is the file that contains all the information you will enter.
- A workbook is made up of sheets. These are the tabs located at the bottom of the table (by default Sheet1, Sheet2,...), we can create up to 255 sheets
- A sheet is composed of cells
- A cell refers to the intersection of a column and a row, exemple: A1, D15, C34,...



The ribbon

The ribbon is displayed the same way as other tools of Office 365, but the options and tools that could be found there are different and adapted to each tools. However there are some identical tools such as bolding, text color, alignment, and illustrations tools,...
To view or hide the ribbon, click on the right arrow in the corner of the ribbon and then on Always show ribbon or Full-screen mode to obtain more screen space.

N.B : Press ctrl+F1 to show or hide your commands in the ribbon.



Formula bar

The formula bar allows you to perform calculations, display the contents of a cell. It can contain values (letters, figures...) or formulas (mathematical functions or operations, various calculations....).
1. To access the other calculation functions which are grouped by theme, click on fx
2. In the window that appears, select the function of your choice
3. Select the concerned cells and click Ok



Table and cells

When you open a new blank workbook, the main area of Excel appears as a giant table.
There is no particular page layout, just rows represented by numbers and columns represented by letters.
The goal is that you can compose your table as you see fit !
1. Each box in this table is called a cell.
2. A cell reference is represented by the intersection of a row and a column.
Example : A1, D15, T3000, ...



Sheets or tabs

The tabs allow you to manage different tables in the same document:
1.It is possible to rename each tab and apply a color to it by double clicking on it
2. To create a new tab or a new sheet, click on the + button on the right, you can insert up to 255 tabs



Duplicate or rename a tab

To duplicate a tab:
1.Go to the tab
2.Right click and select Move or copy
3.In the window that opens, check the box Create a copy and click on Ok to validate
Also, to duplicate a tab, you can click the left mouse button while holding down the control key on your keyboard
When the + appears, place your tab where you want it.
To rename a tab: double click on the name of the tab and enter its name.



Save time using keyboard shortcuts

You want to boost your productivity and save time, use keyboard shortcuts on Excel :
To select all the data of a series and reach the last cell :
1. Place yourself on the first cell in your series
2. Then, hold down the Ctrl + shift + down arrow on your keyboard
3. Your data is thus all selected up to the last cell
To reach a specific cell in your workbook:
1.Press the keys Ctrl + T in your keyboard
2. In the window that opens, enter the cell you want to reach in the field reference and click on ok to validate
3.Excel takes you directly to the specified cell
Other useful keyboard shortcuts:
CTRL+A : Select an area/sheet
CTRL+B : Copy/paste the cell above
CTRL+Shift++ : Insert a row
CTRL - : Delete a row
CTRL + ; : Insert today's date
$ : Block the cells




Record a Macro

To automate certain repetitive tasks, you can record a macro.
Imagine you have dates of random formats and you want to apply a unique format to them, then apply a formatting to the table before printing. A macro can do this for you. You can save it by applying the desired format, formatting and printing and then run it whenever necessary.



Create and manage an Excel table

Excel is a tool known to all allowing you to perform calculations, to represent your data with graphs and to analyze your data. It offers various useful featurs



Create and enter data

Excel is a spreadsheet, you can enter text, number or both.
However, we do not recommend that you do this until you have carefully considered what you want to achieve.
When you enter a number, Excel interprets this data as a figure, by default it is aligned to the right in the cell, if it is text, it is aligned to the left.
1. Create a new folder
2. Enter your data
3. Format your table to make it attractive and easy to pull information from :
- Format the header
- add borders
- Use an automatic filter
- ‚Ä¶



Increment a series automatically

To save time, with Excel, you can create a series automatically: For example a series of numbers from 1 to 100:
1.Enter the first two element of your series, for example 1 and 2
2. Select both cells and go to the bottom right of the cell
3. When the + appears, hold the left cursor of the mouse and go down
NB: You can make the same thing to increment dates; days; months, years...



Modify the format of a cell

There are several possibilities to format a cell, depending on the need, you can either apply a number or currency format..., or use the formatting tools to change the color of the cell, the font,...
1. Select the cells in your workbook.
2. Then in the Home tab of the ribbon, in the command group Number, you have a drop-down list where you can select the format type of your choice.
For example the format currency
Use the Font group to apply a color, border, font size, font type to your cell,...



Wrap text automatically

Do you want to display the contents of the cell on several lines ?
1.Select your cell
2.Click on Wrap Text from the "Alignment" group,



Modify the size of a cell

To change the size of a cell either in width or in height:
1. Select the lines or columns to modify
2. Then, right-click and select row height or column width
3.In the window that opens, define size
4.Click Ok to validate
5.To recenter the information of your cells, you have a group of commands alignment with all the options



Merge cells

To merge cells in Excel:
1.Select cells to merge
2.Then, click merge and center arrow on the Home tab of the ribbon
3.You can then directly merge the cells and center the text
4.Once the cells are merged, you will be able to assign the formatting you want for the cell and the text, all the options are available in the Home tab of the ribbon
5. To unmerge cells, place yourself on the main cell and click on the button merge and center
6. Then, select unmerge cells



Automatic formatting of a table

Use colomun autofill
Flash Fill automatically fills in your data when it detects a pattern.
Example:
You can use Flash Fill to combine Last Names and First Names in a single column, or vice versa.
For example: The column F contains names, and column G First names and you wish to populate the H column with first and last names. If you establish a pattern by entering the full name in the H column, the Instant Fill feature fills in the rest based on the pattern you provide.
1.Enter the complete name in the cell H3, then click ENTER
2.Begin entering the next full name in cell H4. Excel detects the pattern you provide and previews the rest of the column inserting the combined text.
3.To validate the preview, click ENTER



Use Excel to manage your dashboards

A dashboard is a visual representation of key metrics that lets you quickly view and analyze your data in one place.
Excel allows you to create your dashboards but it is also an effective solution to filter and display only what is important to you.



Achieve your first calculations

Formulas perform calculations on the values in your spreadsheet. A formula begins with an equal sign (=) and can contain the following elements:
cell references (example : A1,B1,C1,...)
operators :
-arithmetic operators : (-, +, /, * , ^,...)
-comparison operators : (=, <, <=, >,>=, <>)
-a text concatenation operator : (")
-reference operators : (:,;)



Calculate with arithmetic operators

You can create a simple formula with arithmetic operators to add, substract, multiply or divide values in your spreadsheet. Simple formulas always start with an equal sign (=), followed by constants which are numeric values and arithmetic operators.
Example:
1.In the worksheet, click the cell where you want to enter the formula
2.Type the equals sign (=), followed by cell references A1+B1
3.Press Enter

N.B. :
1.Type =5+2*3 in another cell, then press Enter.> You will notice that Excel multiplies the last two numbers and adds the first number to the result.
Following the standard order of mathematical operations, multiplication and division are performed before addition and subtraction and division before multiplication, addition or substraction.
2.Use the rapid increment from the result cell to fill the columns using the +symbol that appears when you click on the bottom right corner of the cell.



Group your data with the automatic function

To calculate a sum:
1.Go to the cell where you want to view the sum
2.Then, click on the Formluas tab of the ribbon
3.You have an *AutoSum button with a list of calculations, select Sum
4.Select the date range and press the Enter key on your keyboard to validate
5.To update the sum, go to the cell where you inserted the calculation. In the upper ribbon, click on the data range and expand it with the new data using your mouse cursor. Click Enter** to validate.



Discover the statistical functions

Excel offers you the possibility to collect statistical data, to classify them, to analyze them and to represent them graphically.
1.Select the cell in which you want to desplay the result.
2. From the Formula tab, click on Extended choice of functions
3. Select statistics to display the list of statistical functions
4. Click on the desired function, it will be added to your calculation cell
5. To insert a statistical formula directly into a cell, type (=) and write your function followed by a parenthesis
Example 1 : "=Average(D1:D10)", Excel will consider only cells from D1 to D10
6. Press the Enter key to validate the calculation formula
Some basic statistical functions :
- Sum: calculates the sum
- NB: it counts the number of cells containing numeric values
-Average: calculates the average
- Max: locates the maximum value
- Min : locates the minimum value
- COUNTA : Counts the number of cells in a range that are not empty
-COUNTBLANK : Counts the number of empty cells in a specified range of cells



Use the relative reference

Relative Reference is the default calculation mode in Excel. When copying your formula, the cell references change.



Freeze a cell with the absolute reference

The Absolute reference is used to freeze a cell in a calculation formula so that this reference does not change when the formula is copied.
1.Insert your formula, and once the the cell to freeze is selected, click the "F4" key.
2.The cell reference now has the character $ in front of the column letter and in front of the row number : $A$1
3.Finish entering the formula then validate by clicking on OK
N.B: When you press the F4 key, you get an absolute cell reference; if you press F4 a second time, only the row reference becomes absolute; if you press it a third time, the column reference becomes absolute.



And what is the mixed reference ?

A mixed reference consists of either an absolute column and a relative row, or an absolute row and a relative column.
- An absolute column reference is displayed as $A1, $B1, etc.
-An absolute line reference is displayed as A$1, B$1, etc.
If the position of the cell that contains the formula changes, the relative reference is modified, while the absolute reference is not.
If you copy the formula into rows or columns, the relative reference is automatically adapted accordingly, while the absolute reference is not.
Example :
=A1+B$1, copy the cell in the column, you will get this:
=A2+B$1
=A3+B$1



Calculate empty cells with COUNTBLANK

To calculate the number of empty cells:
1.Go to a cell in your table
2.Insert the character = and enter the function COUNTBLANK.
3.Select the data range over which you want to calculate the number of blank cells
4.Click on the ENTER key on your keyboard to validate



Use named areas

To more easily identify a cell or range of cells, you can give it a name.
1.Select the range to assign a name.
2.Open the Formulas tab of the ribbon.
3.Click on the Set a name button.
4.Give a name toUse named areas
the range of cells, and click *on OK.
5.You can now easily identify and use your cell ranges in your formulas using their names.
Example : =A1*TVA (TVA replace cell reference B1)
N.B : you cannot give the same name to 2 cells in the same workbook. the renamed area is reusable across all the sheets of your workbook.
"For more information ask your coach for help"



Highlight your data visually

By applying an automatic format to your tables, Excel will convert it into a dynamic table and offer you a quick analysis tool to create dashboards in 2 clicks.
This format will allow you to access models of/
1. Conditional Formatting
2. Recommended Charts, and Sparkline Charts
3.Automated calculation: Max, Average, Sum...
4.Pivot Tables



Create a chart

If you want to create a chart from A to Z
1.Select your data
2.Click on Insert, then Chart
3.Then click on Recommended charts and choose your model, or the type of chart that will represent best the data in your table



Use chart templates

The purpose of a chart is to display your data analyses. However, a certain type of chart is not always suitable for all types of values. This is why Excel offers you a wide choice of chart templates depending on the data in your table:
1.Histogram or Bar Chart: Simple table data can be represented as vertical columns and horizontal bars.
2.Line chart or area chart: Evolutions (over time) can be represented by associated lines.
3.Piece chart or ring chart: To best represent a distribution, circular or donut charts are ideal. The total area should then correspond to the value 100 percent.
4.Hierarchical chart: allows to better represent the interdependencies
5.scatterplot (X,Y) or a bubble chart: Large volumes of data can also be represented by points (of the same or variable color ) in a coordinate system.
6.Waterfall,sock market, or radar chart: When the values are placed in relation to a central point, this chart allows their arrangement around this point.



Use Sparkline charts

Sparkline charts visualize trends as mini-charts.
1.Enter your data in Excel file
2.Then select them
3.Click on the Insert tab of the ribbon
4.In the Sparkline Charts command group, select the chart of your choice:
-Curve
-Histogram
-Conclusions and Losses
5.Entrer your data range in the Data Range field
6.Finally, customize your chart (display, style,etc;) via the contextual tab Sparkline Chart



Create segments from a dynamic table

Slicers allow you to filter your data and stay organized when analyzing your tables
1.Click anywhere in the table
2.On the Insert tab, in the Filters block, click Segments.
3. In the Insert Slices dialog box, check the boxes for the fields you want to display, then select OK.
4.A segment is created for each selected field. Clicking on one of the buttons in one of the slicers automatically applies that filter to the linked table.
5. To clear filetrs from a segment, select Clear te filter

N.B :
To select multiple items, hold down te Crtl key, then select the items you want to display.



Use styles to make important elements of your table stand out

Use styles and hilight the most important information by setting heights and colors for important cells. These simple presentation techniques will make it easier for you to analyze your organizational data.
1.Select the cells to which you want to apply the table style or click in a cell to apply the style to the whole table,
2.On the Home tab, click the Table cell Styles button in the Style group and, in the list that appears, click the style of the cell you want to highlight evidence.



Analyze and consolidate data from your tables

Excel provides powerful methods to analyse and present your data. With tables, data consolidation and your DCTs, you can easily create and share your customised analyses.



Reorganize and analyze your data

Excel allows you to organise and analyse your data through tables, functions and formulas.
Let's discover together the different possibilities :



Create drop down list

Drop-down lists are used to set up predefined choices for one or more cells and thus avoid input errors.
1.On a new Excel sheet, enter the values you wish to display as a drop-down list
2.Select the cell where you want to insert the drop-down list
3.Open the ribbon tab Data
4.Click on the button Data validation and again on Data validation
5.A new window opens, in Validation criteria under Allow, select List
6.In Source, select the values that will be found in the drop-down list
7.Click on Ok to validate



Activate a total row in a table

You want to add a Total line quickly:
1.In the Table creation tab, check the Total row box from the ribbon
2.A Total row displays the sum of the values in the last column
NB: In some cases, you will need to use other statistical functions, place yourself on the Total cell, a confusing arrow appears displaying the other functions: Average, max, min...



Use table names in your formulas

When you apply the automatic format to a table, a name is generated and is accessible from the left part of the ribbon, you can rename it and use this name in calculation formulas.
Example :
1. Insert in a cell an Average function to calculate the average of the salaries contained in the Salary column of the Table.
2. Select all Table rows containing Salaries (cells K3:K23):=AVERAGE(HR[Salary])
-Excel automatically detects the extent of the range
-salary (K3:K23) and rename it [Salary]
-RH is the name of the Table.

NB : The advantage over a standard range is that if you add or delete rows from the RH table, the AVERAGE formula in the cell updates automatically, because the reference to the range does not change (RH[Salary]).



Consolidate your data

You have similar data in several Excel files and you want to consolidate these data in a summary table ?
Data consolidation allows you to bring all these data in one table.
There are two types of consolidation:
- Consolidation by category: the row and column labels are identical from one list to the next, this allows Excel to know which data should be cumulated.
- Consolidation by position: the row and column labels appear in the same position in each list, Excel will not take into account if these are written identically or not.



Did you say PivotTable

The PivotTable is used to synthesize the data in a database in order to obtain the desired "cross-references" of data.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Few rules before you start

To successfully build your Pivot Tables, you must follow a few rules:
The 1st line contains the field names which must be unique. Example: do not mix CP and City
- A row is a data record
- Do not leave any row or column entirely empty
- Do not merge table cells
- Do not include summary lines (sum, average, etc.)
PS : Avoid distributing data on the same subject in several sheets or workbooks
Example : Avoid creating one tab per city



Create a Pivot Table

Pivot tables allow you to analyze and organize your data in the form of simplified summaries.
Create your Pivot Table from your table:
1.Place yourself in a cell of your table
2.In the Insert tab, click on Pivot Table then on Pivot Tables
3.In the Create PivotTable window, choose the location of your PivotTable report and click OK
4.A new tab opens with an empty pivot table and the PivotTable Fields pane on the right, then check the fields to include in your pivot table
Example: Group salaries by departement (Image bellow)
-Filters allow you to fine-tune your pivot table.
-The columns and rows allow you to cross-reference even more data.
The Values field allows you to perform your calculations and analyses.
5.To move a field from one area to another, drag it to the target area.
N.B: When you update your database, the updating of the pivot table is not done automatically, you must click on Update in the ribbon.



Use PivotTable templates offered by Excel

Excel suggests pivot tables that are particularly suitable for your data, helping you to synthesize and analyze them based on its analysis of the selected range.
1.Place yourself in a cell of your table
2.From the Insert tab, click on Recommended Crosstabs
3.Excel analyzes the selected data and offers you some suitable types of tables
4.Click in the left part of the window on one of the pivot table layouts to get a preview of it in the right part.



Change your data source

After creating a PivotTable, you can change the range of its data source or switch to another external data source.
1.In the PivotTable Analysis tab, in the Data group
2.Click on Change Data Source
3.The Edit PivotTable Data Source dialog box pops up, click the arrow to select a table or range
4.Select OK



Use segments to facilitate the analysis of your PivotTable

Slicers let you segment and filter data dynamically to show only the things you need.
1.Select a cell in the pivot table
2.Under the PivotTable Data Analysis tab that appears in the ribbon, click Insert Slicer
3.Select the fields you want to filter
4.Click on OK, the fields will be automatically inserted on the worksheet



Customize the different connections linked to your segments

You have the possibility to customize your segments, you can for example modify the legend of the segment, change the order of appearance of the data, connect the segment to other pivot tables...
1.Put yourself on your segment, a tab appears in the ribbon named segment which allows you to configure it.
2.You can disable all filters by clicking the Clear filter button or using the [Alt]+[c]
3.Delete a segment by selecting it and then pressing the [Delete] key on the keyboard**.



Insert a timeline to filter dates interactively

Use a timeline to filter dates interactively.
Timelines make it faster and easier to select period to filter functions in PivotTables and PivotCharts.
Example : You want to filter the amout of orders by country for the year 2015
1.Put yourself on your pivot table
2.From the Pivot Table Analysis tab, in the Filter block, click on Insert a timeline
3.Select Year to customize the filter period
4.Choose the period on which you want to apply the filter



Create PivotCharts

PivotCharts allow you to get an overview of your data for easier analysis.
1.Select a cell from your pivot table
2.From the Insert tab, in the Charts block, click on PivotChart in the ribbon
3.Then click on PivotChart in the options
4.In the Insert Chart dialog box, choose your chart template
5.Click on Ok



Manipulate large tables

Excel is a very effective database management tool that allows you to save time, reduce unnecessary effort and quickly analyse your data.
#alternatives#



Database functions

Spreadsheets generally provide a large number of built-in functions for performing data manipulations.
Function Syntax
A function is characterized by its name (by convention written in uppercase), followed by brackets. It can optionally contain arguments (inside parentheses), that is to say a set of values, separated by semicolons, to which the function called FUNCTION will be noted as follows:
FUNCTION(argument1; argument2; ...)



SUMIF

The SUMIF function is used to calculate the sum of wthe values in a range that meets the specified criterion. For example suppose that in column B, you entered item names (Skirts, T-shirts, pants,...), in column D, the sales made.
You want to calculate the turnover only of the sales of "Skirts"
You can use the following formula:=SUMIF(B2:B25,"*skirts*"; D2:D25)
B2:B25 corresponds to the cell range where the criterion is quoted, here the articles.
"*Skirts*" the criterion sought, if your criterion is a text, put an asterix before and after. Example: "*text*"
D2:D25 corresponds to sales and therefore ua CA
The SUMIF function syntax has the following arguments:
SUMIF(range;criterion;[sum_range])



COUNTIF

COUNTIF, one of the Statistics functions that allows you to count the number of cells that meet a criteria; for example to count the number of times the name of a city appears in a customer list.
In its simplest form, the COUNTIF function breaks down as follows:
=COUNTIF(where do you ant to search?;what do you want to search?)
For example :
=COUNTIF(A2:A5;"apples")
Count the number of cells containing "apples" in cells A2 through A5. The result is 2



COUNTIFS

The COUNTIFS function applies criteria to cells in multiple ranges and counts the number of times all criteria are met.
Syntax :
COUNTIFS(range_criteria1; criteria1; [range_criteria2; criteria2]‚Ä¶)
Example :
=COUNTIFS(B2:D2;"=Yes")
> Counts the number of times Davidoski exceeded a sales quota for periods T1, T2 and T3, the result is 1



VLOOKUP

VLOOKUP() is a function to find and retrieve data from a specific column in a table. It is possible, for example, to find the designation and unit price of a product by simply entering its reference.
The syntax is as follows:
=VLOOKUP(lookup_value; array_table;column_number; near_value)
Example : =VLOOKUP(B6;B6:E11;4;WRONG)
- value_searched is "B6": this is the cell where Excel reads the value that leads to the search (example: the reference of a product leads to the search for its price and its description).
- matrix table "B6:E11": this is the range of cells where Excel searches for the values (example: a price list including prices and product descriptions).
- column_number is "4": this is the number of the column of the table where Excel must find the value sought (example: the prices are in the third column of the price list)
- close value: False



Sort and filter your data

Sorting is one of the most common tools for data management. In Excel, you can sort your table by one or more columns, in ascending or descending order, or perform a custom sort.



Text filters

Use filters to temporarily hide some of the data in a table so you can focus on the data you want.
1.Select a cell from the range.
2.Select Data>Sort and filter then click on Filter
3.Select the column header arrow Filter arrow.
4.Click on text filters and then select a comparaison, such as Contains.
5.Enter the filter criteria, then select OK.



Numeric filters

Excel numeric filters allow you to make a selection based on values rater than text.
1.From the Data menu, click Filter
2.Click on Numeric Filters and choose an option, for example Above Average.
3.You will get a list of numbers above the average.



Filter by color

You can quickly filter data basd on visual criteria such as font color cell color, or icon sets.
1.In a cell range or table column, click a cell containing the cell color, font color, or icon you want to filter by.
2.On the Data tab, click Filter.
3.Click the AutoFilter arrow on the column that contains the content to be filtered.
4.Under Filter, from the By Color pop-up menu, select Cell Color, Front Color, or Cell Icon, and click the criterion.



Outline mode

The presentation of EXCEL tables can be unreadable in the presence of too much data. The plan mode available in the "Data" menu makes it possible to solve this equation by hiding the detail of tables (columns and/or rows) while allowing the user to display it in one click and simplifying reading and data analysis.
1.Select rows and columns to hide
2.From the Data menu, click on Plan
3.Select Group and click Group
4.A black line with a - sign is displayed next to the lines to be masked, clicking on the "minus" mask the columns.
5.Clicking on the "plus" makes the hidden data reappear.



Group your data into columns

To group your data into columns:
1.Select columns to hide
2.From the Data menu, click on Plan
3.Select Group and click Group
4.A black line with a - sign is displayed next to the columns to be hidden, clicking on the "minus* button hides the columns.
5.Clicking on the "plus" makes the hidden data reappear.



Group your data into rows

To group your data into rows:
1.Select rows to hide
2.From the Data menu, go to Outline
3.Select Group and click Group
4.A black line with a - sign is displayed next to the lines to be hidden, clicking on the "minus* button hides the lines.
5.Clicking on the "plus" makes the hidden data reappear.



Ungroup a range of cells

To ungroup a range of previously grouped cells:
1.Select the rows to ungroup
2.From the Data menu, go to Outline
3.Select Ungroup and click Ungroup
4.In the dialog box, choose the element to ungroup and click on OK



Clear outline

To turn off Outline mode:
1.From the Data tab of the ribbon, go to Outline
2.Click the arrow under the Ungroup icon and choose Clear Outline from the menu



PowerPoint 2019

PowerPoint is part of the Microsoft Office. It allows you to make presentations in the form of slides, it is possible to integrate text, images, animations, tables, graphics, ....
Some tips to make your presentations successful:
- Use the mask for everything that is recurrent
- Never use more than two fonts in one presentation
- Title size 44 minimum and subtitle size 36 minimum
- Body text minimum 20
- Use illustration tools to convey your messages:
1.a picture is worth a thousand words
2.SmartArt tools to illustrate your ideas
3.graphics to represent your data
4.audios, videos, ...etc



Create your presentations like a pro

Create dynamic presentations in 5 steps without wasting time.
1. Clarify your message
2. Organize your ideas
3. Define your graphic charter
4. Integrate your content
5. Play with animations



Save time by creating presentation templates

Themes and templates make it easy to use the presentation tool without hiring a graphics team. Learn how to play with masks, themes and other design and animation features.



A few rules before you start

Organize your slides and add animations and effects to your text, images, shapes and objects for visually structured presentations.
1. Clarify your message
2. Organize your ideas
3. Define your graphic charter
4. Integrate your content
5. Play with the animations



Create a mask for your presentations

A mask is a template that includes all the recurring elements of a presentation such as the choice of font, size, bullets, theme (corporate design), background, slide layout ...
1. Open a blank presentation then, under the Display tab, click on Slide Mask.
2. Customize the required number of layouts:
- Add or remove placeholders from each affected slide as needed.
- Change the theme, background style, insert logo ... etc
3. To save your template, click on File, then click on Save As.
4. enter the filename and select Powerpoint template (.potx) for the file type, then click Save.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Use an existing template

In order to save time and have consistent slides, consider using your existing presentation templates:
1.open a blank presentation, click on the Design tab
2.choose among the proposed themes, a template to apply to your PowerPoint presentation.



Using Design Ideas

The Powerpoint Designer gives you different layout suggestions when you insert text, an image, a table, an icon, etc.
1. Once you have added your content, a Design Idea pane opens and several layouts are suggested as thumbnails.
2. Click on the layout you are interested in.
3. You can also display the Design Idea pane by clicking on the Design Idea button (Design tab > Designer).



Customize the theme of the presentation

PowerPoint offers various themes to customize your presentation.
To add a theme :
1. click the Design tab on the Ribbon
2. click on the Other arrow to display all the themes available in the application
3) Simply click on the theme of your choice to make it active in your presentation
4) You will be able to customize this theme via the variants command group
5) Click on the arrow Other to display all the options
6.you can change the colors of the theme, the font, add effects and also change the background style



Insert other content

In your PowerPoint presentation, you can insert all kinds of content:
- An image
- A screenshot
- A link
- A video
- An audio file
- and so on.



Inserting notes

In your presentation, you can insert notes. They will not be visible in your slide.
The place to add your notes is below the slide.
To display the notes area, use the arrow to expand the notes area.
2) You can add as many notes as you want, you can then format them using the tools on the Home ribbon (bold, italic, underline)
You can then display your notes or hide them via the Notes button at the bottom right of the page
During your presentation, you will be able to display your notes, they will only be visible to you. To do this:
4.Click on the Slideshow button at the bottom right to start the presentation
5.Then right-click and select Presenter mode.
6.On the right side of the page, you can see the comments of the current slide

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Add slide numbers

If you want to print your presentation, remember to number your pages so that you can find them easily:
1. From the Insert tab, click on Headers and footers.
2. Check Slide number
3. Then click on Apply anywhere.



Add date and time

You can quickly add the current time and date to your slide:
1. From the Insert tab, click on Date and Time from the Text group
2. Check Date and Time, and select the format of your choice
3. Automatic update allows you to update the date when you open the file and not to freeze it



Embedded objects

Embedded objects represent documents or other files that you have inserted into your document. Instead of having separate files, it is sometimes easier to embed them all in the same document.
1. From the Insert tab, click Object in the Text group
2. You can add a new Object by selecting its type and then clicking Ok.
3. Or insert an object from a file, check from a document, click Browse to select your file, then click OK



Use illustrative objects to enhance your presentations

Illustration objects are essential elements for successful PowerPoint presentations. They help draw attention and reinforce key messages.



Uses existing media

Using the Media group in the Insert tab, you can add a recording of your screen, insert audio or video to a slide.



Insert a picture

You can insert images, photos or clipart into your slide show from your computer or the Internet.
- Inserting an image from your computer onto a slide
1. On the Insert tab, go to the Pictures group, click Pictures, then click This Device.
2. In the dialog box that opens, find the image you want to insert, select it, and then click Insert.
- Inserting picture stored on a slide
1. Click Stored Images.
2. Type the description of the image you are looking for, click on the images you want to insert, then click Insert.
- Insert an image from the web on your slide 1.
1. Click on Online picture .
2. In the search box, type the description of the image you are looking for, then press enter.
3. Select the picture you want, then click Insert..



Format your picture

After adding an image, there are many ways to enhance it, for example, with backgrounds, shadows or other effects, to better convey your message:
- Adjust brightness, contrast or sharpness
- Apply artistic effects
- Change the color
- Apply image effects
- Add a border
- Compress the image
- Reset the image
- ... etc



Replace a picture

You can replace an image in your slide with another image:
1.From the Image Format tab, select Change picture
2) Choose the storage location for the new image (from file, from stored images, ...)
3) Once you have found the image you want, double-click on it



Insert a capture

In PowerPoint, you can capture a window or part of a window and insert it into the presentation.
To insert a capture of a window :
1. open the window you want to capture in the background
Display the slide on which you want to insert the screenshot.
Open the Insert tab and click screenshot. The windows open in the background are displayed as thumbnails.
Click on the thumbnail corresponding to the window you want to insert in the slide

N.B.: To save time, use the keyboard shortcuts [WINDOWS + SHIFT + S], move to the slide on which you want to insert the screenshot and press the [ Ctrl + V]** keys



Insert audio

You can add audio, for example, music, narration or a sound sample, to your PowerPoint presentation. You can insert existing audio from the PC or simply record new audio.
To insert audio:
1. Select Insert > Audio.
2. Click on Audio on my PC.
3. In the dialog box, Insert Audio item and select the audio file you want to add.
To record audio:
1. Select Record Audio.
2. Enter a name for your audio file, select Save, and then speak



Insert a video

PowerPoint allows you to insert a video to your slide and add it to your PowerPoint presentation.
1. select Insert
2.click on Videos, you can :

- Insert a video from your PC

- Insert a video from the stock video library

- Insert a video online
1. In the web browser, search for the desired video and copy the URL of the web page.
2. Return to PowerPoint and select Video > Online Video.
3. In the Online Video dialog box, paste the previously copied URL.
4. Select Insert.

**Note: Online videos supported are from Youtube, Slideshare, Vimeo and Stream.



SmartArt

Easily insert Icons, SmartArt, Shapes, Graphics into your PowerPoint slides and presentation. Once these elements are in place, you can rotate, color and resize them without any loss of image quality.



Insert a SmartArt

Create SmartArt graphics for a consistent visual representation of your information. You can choose from several layouts:
1. Under the Insert tab, click on SmartArt.
2. In the Choose SmartArt Graphic dialog box, click the desired type and layout.
3. Click Ok and type in your text.



Modifying a SmartArt

You can change the layout, type and colors of a SmartArt graphic:
1. Click on the SmartArt concerned and activate the contextual Create tab. you can now change :
- The type of the graphic,
- The colors
- Add a shape, a bullet, ...
To get back to the original presentation, click on the Restore Chart button from the ribbon



SmartArt formatting

PowerPoint provides you with rich functionality for cropping, rotating, painting and other formatting needs of SmartArt graphics:
1.Click on the relevant SmartArt and activate the Shape contextual tab. you can now:
- Modify the shape
- Increase or decrease the size of the shape
- Adjust the appearance of your shape
- Create a textual description
- Organize the positioning of the graphic



Insert icons

PowerPoint offers you many icons that you can resize, move and format:
1. Select Insert and click on Icons.
2. Scroll through the icons or go to a category by clicking on a name in the left navigation pane.
3. Choose an icon and click Insert .
4. You can insert multiple icons at once by clicking on each one before clicking Insert.



Create interactive presentations

To give life to your presentation, think of inserting objects such as tables, graphs, shapes, ... it will make your slide more attractive



The tables

You want to organize your data and work efficiently, use tables and better structure your document:
1. Click on the Insert tab
2. Click on Table and select the number of columns and rows you want



The graphics

To better analyze your data, consider inserting graphs:
1. From the Insert tab, click on Graphs.
2. Then choose the type of your graph
3. Once added, an Excel file is created, it allows you to add and modify data directly from a table.



Forms

You want to add predefined shapes, such as circles, squares and arrows:
1. On the Insert tab, click Shapes.
2. Click on the desired shape, then drag the mouse to outline the shape.
3. You can use the Shift key while dragging the mouse to adjust the dimensions of the shapes.



The connectors

Vous pouvez ajouter des traits pour connecter des formes ou en utiliser pour pointer vers des √©l√©ments d‚Äôinformations. Les connecteurs peuvent √™tre droits, en angle ou en autre forme .
1. Sous l‚Äôonglet Insertion, dans le groupe Illustrations, cliquez sur Formes.
2. Sous lignes, cliquez sur le connecteur √† ajouter.
3. Positionnez le pointeur de la souris sur la forme ou l‚Äôobjet auxquels vous voulez attacher le connecteur. Des points de connexion s‚Äôaffichent, indiquant que votre trait peut √™tre connect√© √† la forme.



Go further on PowerPoint

D√©couvrez les autres astuces et bonnes pratiques d'usages sur PowerPoint .



Tips and best practices

PowerPoint is an essential, functional and ergonomic tool that can help you create personalized and attractive presentations, provided you know the right tips to do so quickly.
1. A slide for a single idea: You need little text and well-chosen words leading to a single idea per slide.
2. Avoid inserting too many animations
3. Make a brief plan, an introduction and a conclusion
4. Personalize and adapt your presentation to your audience
5. Stay consistent in your PowerPoint presentation



Save a slideshow

You can record your oral comments during the slide show as well as the display time for each slide. This is useful if you want to transmit the video version of your presentation, for example.
1. Go to the slide from which the recording should start.
2. Activate the Slideshow tab and click on the lower part of the Record Slideshow button
3. Click Record from Start to start the slideshow and begin recording from the first slide or click Record from Current Slide to start from the active slide.



Incorporate an Excel sheet into a presentation

If you want to insert an Excel sheet into your presentation, follow these steps:
1. click on the Insert tab of the ribbon
2) Click on Table and then on Excel Spreadsheet.
An Excel spreadsheet appears in your slide, you can use the calculation features as if you were in Excel.
Note; If you want to modify your table later



Add timing between slides

When you present the content of your presentation, you can customize the timing between slides.
1. click the Transitions tab on the Ribbon
2) In the ribbon, you have a group of commands Timing.
Here you can define a sound that will be played between your slides
4) Define the duration of this sound and if you want to apply this sound between all the slides or between the slide you are on and the next one.
By default, you manually start the transition to the next slide, you can define an automatic transition after a defined time.
Warning: with this feature, after the set time, the presentation will automatically move to the next slide even if you have not finished your presentation. We therefore advise you to leave a manual skip.



Register your screen

You can record the video and audio from your computer screen and embed it in your PowerPoint slide or save it as a separate file.
Open the slide you want to embed the recording in and click on the Insert tab
Select Screen Recording.
In the Control Panel, click Select Area, if you want to select a portion of the screen for recording.
Click on Record.



Insert a hyperlink

Les liens hypertextes permettent d'enrichir vos documents Word, Excel, Outlook et PowerPoint en les connectant √† des sources en ligne.
Pour ins√©rer un lien hypertexte depuis n'importe quelle application de la suite office 365 :
1.S√©lectionnez la zone de texte dans laquelle vous voulez ins√©rer un lien, puis sous l‚Äôonglet Insertion,
2.S√©lectionnez Lien.
3.Entrez le texte personnalis√© dans le champ Texte √† afficher
4.Collez l‚ÄôURL dans le champ Adresse puis cliquez sur OK pour valider



Present in Teams

You are in a meeting and you want to present your slides, you can do it directly from PowerPoint :
1. From the Slideshow* tab, click on Present in Teams.
2. You will be taken directly to your current meeting
3. Finally, click on Present** to display the PPT



Animate your presentations

Enhance your PowerPoint presentations by adding interactive features and many creative animations.



Activate the transcription function for the hearing impaired

PowerPoint allows you to display live subtitles in the slideshow during a presentation:
1. From the Slideshow tab, in the Live Subtitles group, configure the subtitle settings
2. Choose the language of your subtitles, by default it is the same language as your spoken language, you can however change it
3. Define the desired position of the subtitles. They appear on the top or bottom margin of the slide (covered) or they appear above the top or below the bottom of the slide (anchored).
4. Click the Other Settings (Windows) to change the color, size, transparency and font style of the subtitles.



Slide link

To add a hyperlink between two slides in the same PPT presentation:
1. Start by selecting the text, shape or image to be used as a hyperlink in normal mode.
2. On the Insert tab, click on Hyperlink.
3. From the Insert Hyperlink dialog box and under Link to, click Place in this document.
4. Click on the destination slide for the link.
To add a link to a slide in another presentation:
1. Click on Hyperlink. Under Link to, click on Existing file or web page.
2. Then browse for the file containing the destination slide and select it,
3. Click on Bookmark and click on the title of the destination slide of the link.




Reuse existing slides

You can add one or more slides to your presentation from another PowerPoint file without opening it first:
To reuse slides from an existing presentation:
1. click on Reuse Slides in the Home tab of the Ribbon
2) A window opens on the right side of the page, use the search bar to find the document you want to reuse
3) Once you have found your document, simply click on the slide(s) you wish to insert in your PowerPoint file
4) By default, the original formatting is kept, if you don't want to apply it, uncheck the Use source formatting option



Find information

Office 365 has a powerful search engine that can be found in most applications. Thus, you will quickly find:
- Documents that you have created, modified or that your colleagues have shared with you
- Your organization's contacts
- Documents received as an attachment
- The different team spaces of which you are a member
- The expertise of your colleagues
- ...



Search with Office 365 portal

From the Office 365 portal, you can look for any information on your contact, document, app, ...
No matter if the information is in Onerive, Teams, SharePoint, Outlook.,...the search is done on files name and content, and also on image and pdf !



Find a document

To find a document :
1. Tape your keywords in the search bar and press Enter key.
2. Results appear, click on Files tab to search for documents only.
3. Use Filters to help you find the document you are looking for.



Find contact information

If you are looking for information regarding a colleague :
1. Enter name of this contact in the search bar of the Office 365 portal.
2. Click on the proposal to show his/her card
3. Here you will find everything regarding this contact.
4. Use the different tabs to find the information quickly :
- In Contact tab find here all useful information : phone number, email address, location, job title, resume,... Remember to always check your contact availability before calling.
- In Organization tab, see the organization chart related to this person. Find who is his/her manager, the other members of his/her department, ...
- Files tab gathers all the commons documents recently opened by your colleague. Refine the search by entering key words in the small search bar on the top right.
- In Email tab, you will see the last email conversations with your contact



Look for a specific skill

You can search for a person with a specific competence to help you on a project for instance :
1. In the search bar of Office 365 portal, enter the skills you are looking for and press Enter key
2. In People tab, see here which people have added this skills in his/her profile



Find an app

Office 365 apps are accessible from the Office 365 portal
1. or from anywhere on Office online with the app launcher
2. at the top left. Finally you can also use the search bar
3. to find an app.



Search in OneDrive

OneDrive has a search engine that allows you to find your documents according : types of file, keywords, dates, peoples..
1. Enter your keyword in the search bar of OneDrive and press Enter key
2. Click on the arrow at the right of the search bar to select the scope of your search.
3. Use the funnel icon at the right of the page to filter your search.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Find a document shared by someone else

When a colleague share a document with you from his own OneDrive space, you receive an email with a link to the file.
To find again this document once you have deleted the email :
1. From OneDrive, click on Shared tab in the left menu
2. To find easily a file use filters available via the funnel icon at the top right.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Find documents I have shared

To have an overview of all documents you have already shared with colleagues and be able to edit permissions :
In OneDrive, click on Shared in the left menu
Choose Shared by you tab



Find recently opened files

To find easily the last document you have edited, click on Recents on the left menu of OneDrive.
This space gather your last documents from today until last month.



Search in Teams

In Teams, files are stored in channels of each Team. To find easily documents of the teams your are member, we advise you to use the Teams search bar.
1. Enter your keyword in the search bar and press Enter key
2. Choose to restrict the search : to messages, to people or to files.
3. Refine your search with advanced filters.



Find a contact in Teams

To join a contact quickly in Teams, use the search bar :
1. Enter the name of your contact in the search bar
2. Click on this person in the proposal
3. You can then discuss thanks to Teams chat.
NOTE : check the availability statuts of your contact before engaging conversation



Find my last activities in Teams

The Activity tab (1) allow you to find the latest information that concerns you : Messages, mentions, calls, ...
When you have not read an activity, it appears in bold.
To find an information here :
2. Clic on the funnel icon
3. Enter a keyword
4. Or click ... to filter your activities.



Optimize your search in Outlook

In Outlook, you can spend a lot of time looking for information. Fortunately, by using the Outlook search engine efficiently, you can find anything very quickly!
1. Enter your keyword in the Outlook search bar and press the Enter key
2. A new contextual tab then appears in Outlook, the Search tab
3. Here you can reduce the scope of your search
4. And refine it according to: sender, subject, attached attachments, categories, etc ...



Launch again a recent search

In Outlook , don't loose time making the same exact search you made 2 hours ago !
Indeed, your 10 last searches are kept in memory.
1. Click on the search bar, a new contextual tab appear : the Search tab
2. Choose Recent searches
3. Select the one you want to search again



Search in OneNote

Search your notes in the OneNote tool:
1. Click on the Search tab represented by a magnifying glass on the left
2. Enter your keyword in the search bar and press Enter key.
3. Choose the scope of your search
4. The pages containing your keyword are displayed.

Click to read document üìñ



Search tags in OneNote

If you are using tags in OneNote, you can search them :
1. Click on the Search tab represented by a magnifying glass on the left
2. Enter your tag name in the search bar and press Enter key.
3. Choose the tags tab
4. The pages containing your tag are displayed.



View recent modifications in OneNote

In OneNote, recently edited pages by other users are marked bold (1).
Check that the Hide authors button (2) is not activated in the View tab in order to be able to see the author of the modifications (3).



Yammer

Yammer is a corporate social network that allows you to:
- Create a community around common interests in order to connect users and allow them to share expertise and resources.
- Cultivate management commitment to allow the organization to feel close to the senior management team.
- Encourage employees to share comments, to raise issues regardless of where the users are.
- Foster collaboration by openly sharing ideas, receiving feedback, and using @mentions to encourage collaborators with expertise to join the conversation.

Click to read document üìñ



Discover Yammer

Yammer is a corporate social network that allows you to:
-Create a community around common interests in order to connect users and allow them to share expertise and resources.
-Cultivate management commitment to allow the organization to feel close to the senior management team.
-Encourage employees to share comments, to raise issues regardless of where the users are.
-Foster collaboration by openly sharing ideas, receiving feedback, and using @mentions to encourage collaborators with expertise to join the conversation.



Stay up to date

To be informed without being inundated with information, you can configure the notifications:
1. Click on the settings wheel at the top right
2. Then click on Edit settings
3. In the notifications tab, check the notifications of your choice.
4. Select the group (s) for which you want to configure notifications.
5. Finally click on Save

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Help your colleagues to know you better

Fill out your profile to help your colleagues get to know you better.
To complete your profile:
1. Click on the settings wheel at the top right
2. Then click on Edit settings
3. In the profile tab, fill in : Your expertise (s), Your interest and Your past experiences and Save

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Find your way in Yammer

On the Yammer home page, you will find:
1. Your inbox when messages are sent to you through Yammer
2. Your favorite communities
3. All communities
4. The discussion space
5. The Yammer settings
6. Community suggestions that might interest you.



From the desktop app

You can download the Yammer application on your computer (Windows and Mac).
The Yammer desktop app lets you reach out to your managers or colleagues, share and discover knowledge, and contribute to the communities that interest you within your organization.
NOTE: You must have Windows 7 or Mac OS 10.9 at least.



From Office 365 portal

To access Yammer from the Office 365 portal:
Open the internet browser of your choice
Enter the address office.com (enter your professional email address and your Windows password if necessary)
Once on the portal, open the Yammer app on the left side of the page.



On the go

Thanks to the Yammer mobile app, company members can stay connected while on the go.
This capacity for interaction increases their involvement and participation.
Download the app for free on your iOS or Android smartphone or tablet.



Access Yammer

Yammer allows you to reach out to your managers or colleagues, share and discover knowledge, and contribute to the communities that interest you.
You can access Yammer:
Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Create a Yammer community

A community allows you to share ideas, work in groups on topics and react in real time to publications.
There are two types of community:
- Internal community
- External community

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



External community

To create an external community:
1. In the Yammer home page, click Create community at the bottom left of the page
2. In the page that opens, click on Edit in the settings
3. In the Internal or external field, select External to collaborate with people outside your organization
4. Set the community access : select Public (all members of your network can view and join) or Private * (only approved members can join and participate )
5. Give a name to the community
6. Add a description
7. Add members
8. Finally click on Create **



Internal community

To create an internal community:
1. In the Yammer home page, click Create community at the bottom left of the page
2. In the page that opens, click on Edit in the settings
3. In the Internal or external field, select Internal to collaborate only with your colleagues within your organization
4. Set the community access : select Public (all members of your network can view and join) or Private * (only approved members can join and participate )
5. Give a name to the community
6. Add a description
7. Add members
8. Finally click on Create **



Add a new admin to a community

By default, the administrator of a community is the creator of that community. But it is possible to appoint other administrators who will also be able to manage the community and its members.
1. Go to the community and click on the number of members on the right.
2. The list of members appears, click on the ... in front of the name of the person to make him admin

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Change language

You can change the language of your Yammer app:
1. Click on the settings wheel at the top right
2. Then, click on Edit settings
3. Go in Preferences tab
4. Click on the language to change it

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Organize your message by topic

Different topics are discussed in community discussions and also in your private messages.
To keep track of this key information, you can add labels to gather and find easily this information.
1. In the relevant message, click on the ...
2. Then, click on Add topics
3. Add your subject (s)
4. Click Add
