5. Enter the name of the subject that you have just specified in the search bar and select topics in order to highlight all the messages concerned.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Post a message in Yammer

To post a message to a community in Yammer:
1. From the Yammer home page, click Start Discussion
2. Enter your message
3. Format it
4. Add the community where the message will be published
5. Add attachments as needed
6. If it's a question and no longer a simple message, switch to Question mode
7. Finally click on Post

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Communicate effectively in Yammer

Yammer allows you to easily adapt communication and exchange to your needs.
1. The Discussion allows you to publish a new message
2. Click on Question to post a question
3. Use the Compliment feature to thank and encourage your colleagues for their actions
4. Need advice quickly? Organize a poll and view voter feedback in one click
Note: Do not hesitate to mention your colleagues with @ so that they receive a notification. This makes it possible to target the person (s) concerned.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Send a private message

You can send a private message via the Inbox:
1. Click on Inbox
2. Then on New private message
3. Enter your message
4. Add the contact (s) to whom you want to send your message
5. Personalize your message
6. Click Post

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



React to a message in Yammer

In Yammer participate and react to posts:
1. Add a Like to a post
2. Comment a post
3. Share a publication in a community, in a private message or share the link to it.
4. By clicking on the ... in front of the conversation, access the other options:
- Move the conversation to another community
- Follow the conversation in your inbox
- View or collapse the conversation
- Edit the subject of the conversation



Access community files

To access files of a community :
1. Open the community
2. Simply click on the Files tab to view all the documents that was shared here.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Add files

To add a file to a community:
1. Open the community
2. Then, click on the Files tab
3. You can here Load an existing document from your file explorer
4. Or Create a new Word document or a new PowerPoint presentation.
The entire community will be able to access the file via the Files tab.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Add link to your posts

To share a link or if you want to share a file which is already stored in the cloud, you can link the file and paste it directly into the Yammer conversation.
1. Go to the space where the document is stored, right click on the document and Copy link
2. Start a new discussion in Yammer in the desired community
3. Paste the link in the text part
4. Click on Post to send your message

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Edit community settings

To modify the settings of a community:
1. Click on the ... under the background image, then click on Settings
2. Here you can edit the Name of the community and add a Description
3. In the Members field you can add members directly from a CSV file by clicking on Add from address book (CSV) in order to import your Outlook contacts for example.
4. You can modify the access settings and the posts of messages in your community:
- Public access: Any network can post and publish posts in the community
- Private access: Only members can post in the community
5. Finally click on Save

NOTE : You must be admin of the community



Share a picture or a video

From Yammer, you can easily share photos or videos with your communities:
1. Go in the community to which you want to share the content
2. Start a Discussion and enter your message
3. Then click on the attachement icon and add your file
4.Finally click on Post
Note: Documents added to groups conversations are stored in the Files tab of those conversations. They are accessible to all members of the community.



Follow important information

You can follow important information and be informed of a new message :



By topic

Different topics are discussed in community discussions and also in your private messages.
To keep track of this key information, you can add labels to gather and find easily this information.
1. In the relevant message, click on the ...
2. Then, click on Add topics
3. Add your subject (s)
4. Click Add
5. Enter the name of the subject that you have just specified in the search bar and select topics in order to highlight all the messages concerned.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



By people

To follow a person and thus be informed of the messages published by him:
1. Enter the name of this person in the search bar
2. Then, click on Follow at the top right of the page

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



By conversation

When a conversation interests you and you want to follow the discussions:
1. Click on the ...
2. Then click on Follow in Inbox
3. You can now find the entire conversation in your inbox on the left side of the page.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



By community

To get more involved, Yammer recommends a wide choice of communities. Join the ones that interest you:
1. On the Yammer home page, click Discover more groups
2. You can join a group from the Recommended for you tab
3. You can also view All Groups
4. Do not hesitate to use the search bar to find groups with the same domain as you
5. Once you have clicked on the group you want to follow, click Join

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Find easily your favorite communities

To easily find a group add it as a favorite:
1. Open the communities and click on the heart
2. The community will now be accessible with one click in the Favorites in the left pane

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Custom a community

To personalize your groups you can add: a background image, an avatar, important links for the community. For that :
1. Open the community you want to customize
2. Click on the existing imag to * upload a new image from your file explorer, an avatar for example.
3. Click Update Cover Photo and then Upload Cover Photo to change the community background image.
4. Click the + (add link) button in front of Pinned to add important files or links to the community.

NOTE** : You must be Admin of the community



See community insights

With Yammer, you can view the community activity feed:
1. Open the community for which you want to have an activity report and click on About
2. You see the subscribers and the people who follow the community page
3. For a more detailed activity dashboard, click on See more
4. Select the activity period that interests you
5. Click on Export options for on Download CSV file to export the report to Excel for further analysis



Delete a community

To delete a community:
1. Click on the ... under the background image
2. Then click on Settings
3. At the bottom of the page, click on Delete
4. In the page that opens, click on Delete

NOTE : You must be Admin of the community



Word 2022

Word is a word processing tool that offers many possibilities:
- Manage long documents with tables of contents, styles, lists, headers and footers, etc.
- Generate a mailing from several sources (Outlook, Excel,...)
- Revise a document in a simple and effective way
Some tips to make your documents successful:
- Use bulleted lists and auto-numbering
- Use the review tools to proofread your documents
- Use the illustration tools to support your text



Adopt good practice for your Word documents

You want to create a Word document, start by adding text:
1. Click on the desired location
2. Enter the text, it will be automatically inserted in the paragraph.
The layout of a Word document, in addition to titling, starts with adjusting the paragraphs.
Many commands are available in the Paragraph section of the Ribbon. But there are keyboard shortcuts for Word, place the mouse cursor at the beginning of the paragraph concerned before applying them.



Discover the basic functions of Word

The layout of a Word document, in addition to titling, starts with adjusting the paragraphs.
Many commands are available in the Paragraph section of the Ribbon. But there are keyboard shortcuts for Word, place the mouse cursor at the beginning of the paragraph concerned before applying them.
Center a paragraph: Ctrl + E
Justify a paragraph: Ctrl + J
Align a paragraph to the left: Ctrl + Shift + G
Align a paragraph to the right: Ctrl + Shift + D
Indent a paragraph to the left: Ctrl + M
Create a negative first line indent: Ctrl + T
Reduce a negative first line indent: Ctrl + Shift + T
Delete the formatting of a paragraph: Ctrl + Q



Create a document

You want to create a Word document, start by adding text:
1. Click on the desired location
2. Enter the text, it will be automatically inserted in the paragraph.
The layout of a Word document, in addition to titling, starts with adjusting the paragraphs.
Many commands are available in the Paragraph section of the Ribbon. But there are keyboard shortcuts for Word, place the mouse cursor at the beginning of the paragraph concerned before applying them.
Center a paragraph: Ctrl + E
Justify a paragraph: Ctrl + J
Align a paragraph to the left: Ctrl + Shift + G
Align a paragraph to the right: Ctrl + Shift + D
Indent a paragraph to the left: Ctrl + M
Create a negative first line indent: Ctrl + T
Reduce a negative first line indent: Ctrl + Shift + T
Delete the formatting of a paragraph: Ctrl + Q



Save a document

You don't want to lose your data? Think of saving them to be able to access them later.
To save a document :
1. Click on the Save command
2. In the new window that appears, enter the name of the file and choose the storage location
3. Then click on Save.

**N.B.: Enable automatic saving of your files by storing them in OneDrive or SharePoint. This allows automatic saving at regular intervals, every few seconds while you work



Rename a document

If you want to change the name of a file without having to close it to go through the file explorer, save it in the cloud (OneDrive, SharePoint, ...) and follow these steps:
1. Click on the title in the top bar of Word
2. Change the name of your document



Enter text

You want to create a Word document, start by adding text:
1. Click on the desired location
2. Type the text, it will be automatically inserted in the paragraph.



Using symbols and special characters

At some point you will have to insert characters that do not exist in your document, such as Greek letters or symbols. But unfortunately, it is impossible to find them on your keyboard.
1. Click on Insert
2. In the Symbol block, select Symbols.
3. If you can't find your symbol, click on Other symbols.
4. In the dialog box that appears, select the Font, the symbol and click Insert.

**Note: When you use the same symbol often, you can :
- Add it to the automatic corrections
- Or associate it with a shortcut key by clicking on the Shortcut Keys button.



Undo and redo an action

You made changes by mistake and you want to undo them. Don't panic, there is always a way to go back.
- To undo and redo successive actions:
1. Click the [Undo] or [Redo] button one or more times. Word undoes or redoes the last action(s).
or,
2. Press and hold the [Ctrl] key.
3. Press the [Z] key once or more to undo and [Y] to redo.
- To undo a selected action
1. Scroll to the [Undo] button
2. Click on the action you want to undo
Word cancels the list of actions that follow the selected action.





What is the purpose of The Models?

A template is a document containing pre-registered information:
- Automatic insertions.
- Macros, these are procedures or functions written in Visual Basic for Application (VBA) language that automate certain tasks.
- The configuration of the menu bars, when you modify the menus, they are saved in the active template in order to find your modifications later.
- The configuration of the toolbars, just like for the menus.
A template is saved by Word with a different extension: ".dotx".
To understand the concept of a template, think about your stationery. If you are a :
- professional, it contains your logo, your names, addresses and other ;
- individual, it may contain only a small drawing (possibly watermarked).
To write your mail, you use this stationery. Well, in Word, your stationery is your template and you will create your letter using this template. Of course, as mentioned above, it does not only contain text or drawings.



Create a document template

To create a document template you can use several methods:
- 1st method:
1. In the File tab, click on New ,
2. Choose your basic template (the normal template is called "empty document"), and click on it
3. A new window appears, click on Create.
4. Then save this template.

- 2nd method:
1. Create a document as usual.
2. When saving, in the dialog box, select Document Template (*.dot) from the File Type** list at the bottom of the box.
3. Once you have selected template as the file type, the save dialog box automatically moves to the folder that contains all the templates. This folder can and should be organized into subfolders.
4. Do not put your templates loose in this folder, but create subfolders to organize your templates.
5. When you open the New dialog box it will show up with new tabs, each sub-folder corresponds to a tab.



Modify a template

To edit a document template:
1. From the File tab, click on Open.
2. Locate the template file on the disk and click on it
3. Make any changes and click Save.

Note: To distinguish a document from a template, the template is saved by Word with a different extension: ".dotx "**



Formatting a paragraph

For an optimal display of your text on the page:
1. From the Home tab; Use the option group named Paragraph.
2. Access the different formatting options you can apply to paragraphs:
- Alignment
- Tabs
- Line spacing
- Paragraph spacing
- Borders and background
- Bullets and numbering - etc.



Change the line spacing of a paragraph

The line spacing represents the space between the lines of a paragraph. The default value is 1.15.
To assign 1.5 or 2 line spacing (double spacing)
1. Click on the Home tab
2. Pull down the Line Spacing button in the Paragraph group
3. Choose the desired line spacing (1.5 or Double)
4. Click on Ok



Change the spacing between paragraphs

Paragraph spacing determines the space above and below a paragraph. By default, the spacing is 10 pts after the paragraph.
1. Select the relevant paragraphs
2. Click on the Page Setup tab of the Ribbon
3. Change the spacing in the Paragraph group
Or
2. Click on the Home tab
3. In the Paragraph group dialog box, change the spacing



Adjusting paragraph indents

With the ruler above the page you can shift a paragraph with a simple drag of the mouse. The Paragraph dialog box will give you even more precision.
1. Move to the paragraph
2. From the Home tab, click on the arrow at the bottom right of the paragraph group.
3. Set the indents
4. Click on Ok to validate
Or, use your keyboard to indent.
1. Press the [Ctrl] and [R] keys simultaneously.
2. To increase the indentation, press the [Ctrl] and [R] keys again.
3. To undo all indents, press [Ctrl] and [Q] keys simultaneously.




Create borders and background frames

You want to quickly frame a paragraph with a border:
1. Select the paragraph to be framed
2. Click on the Home tab
3. Pull down the Borders button in the Paragraph group and click on Borders and Frames.
4. Click on the chosen border template.

To place a background border on a paragraph:
1. Select the paragraph
2. Pull down the Background Frame button
3. Click on the chosen color
4. Click on Other colors to access a large selection of colors



Create a bulleted list

To organize your document on multiple levels (Heading 1, Heading 2, ... ) or a bulleted list, use the following paragraph features:
1. click on the arrow next to the bullets button to display all available bullet styles
2.From the list, select the bullet you want to display
You can also create a custom bullet by clicking on Define Bullet....
3. To add a bullet on a second title, you can do the same thing.
4. You can also select the first title/text to be bulleted
5. Then click on the Reproduce formatting brush at the top left of the ribbon
6. Finally, click on the second title/text where you have added the bullet and it will be visible on it

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Create a numbering

To organize your document on several levels (Heading 1, Heading 2, ... ) or a numbered list, use the following paragraph features:
1. select the title on which you want the bullet to appear
2) Then click on the arrow next to the numbering button to display all available numbering styles
3) From the list, select the numbering you want to be displayed
You can also create a custom numbering by clicking on Define a new numbering format... 5.
To add a numbering on a second title, use the brush as for the creation of a bulleted list and the numbering will be done following.

Click here to see the video ‚èØ



Managing tabs with Word

For an optimal display of your text on the page:
1. From the Home tab; Use the option group named Paragraph.
2. Access the different formatting options you can apply to paragraphs:
- Alignment
- Tabs
- Line spacing
- Paragraph spacing
- Borders and background
- Bullets and numbering - etc.



Create Tabs

To separate and align text or numbers perfectly, forget the space bar! Have the right reflex and use tabs.
To choose a tab :
1. Click on the left end of the horizontal ruler
2. Choose one of the 4 types of tabs offered by Word: Left, right, centered, and decimal
3. Click on the ruler at the desired location
4. Word places a tab stop on the ruler



Move, modify, and delete a tab

To move a tab :
1. Click on the tab and hold down the mouse button
2. Drag the tab to the right or to the left

To change a tab :
1. Double click on the tab stop
2. From the dialog box that opens, choose the position of the tab to modify
3. Select the type of alignment
4. Click on Define.
5. Finally, select Ok.

To delete a tab:
1. Click on the tab stop
2. Drag it out of the ruler, to the document page

**N.B. : If the tabulation applies to several paragraphs, it is essential to select them to apply the modification to the whole document



Use tabs with continuation points

Leader stitches draw a line of dots, dashes, or solid line to the left of the tab you apply them to.
1. Double-click on the tab in the ruler
2. From Position , choose the tab to which the continuation points are to be applied
3. Click on the type of continuation points chosen
4. Click on Define and then on Ok.



Tables in Word

In this chapter, you will learn how to insert and format tables in Word.



Create a table

A table is made up of rows and columns. The rectangular area located at the intersection of a row and a column is called cell
To create a table in Word:
1.Click on the Insert tab
2.Click on the Table button
3.Move the mouse pointer to the desired location to indicate the number of rows and columns
4.Click on the last cell, your table will be inserted in your Woed document



Standardize the columns and rows of your table

Changing the width of columns and the height of rows is not always accurate. It is therefore important to standardize them to make them equal.
To make the width of the columns of your table uniform:
1. Select your table, then click on the Page Setup tab which appears in the ribbon,
2. In the block Cell size, click on the tab Cell size.
3. Click on Uniform Columns.

To make your table row heights uniform:
1. Select the Page Setup tab,
2. In the Cell Size block
3. Click on Uniform Lines.



Inserting an Excel Table

Creating a table in Excel offers much more functionality than a simple Word table. However, you can include the Excel table in a Word document.
1. From the Insert tab, click on Table
2. Then click on Excel Spreadsheet.
3. Enter your data in the Excel window



Add, delete columns, rows

To add or remove columns and rows from a table in Word:
1. Click anywhere in the table you want to edit. The table tools appear above the Ribbon.
2. From the Page Setup tab, the options for inserting and deleting rows and columns appear in the Rows and Columns block.
3. Place your cursor at the point in the table where you want to add a column or row.
- To insert a row, click insert above or insert below.
- To insert a column, click insert left or insert right.
4. To delete columns or rows, place your cursor on the column or row, select the Delete button and click on the action of your choice.



Merge, cells of a table

You can merge several cells in the same row or column into one cell:
1.Select the cells you want to merge.
2. From the Layout tab, in the Merge group, click on Merge Cells.



Split a Table

To split cells:
1. Click in a cell or select all cells to split.
2. From the Layout tab, in the Merge group, click on Split Cells.
3. Type the number of columns or rows to split the selected cells into.



Manage your long documents efficiently in Word

Discover in this section other advanced features of Word



Manage your long documents

When working on a long Word document, many options are available to manage it more easily



Create styles for your long documents

You can use styles to quickly apply a set of consistent formatting choices throughout your document. You can change the formatting (i.e : the font size, color and indentation of text) in styles applied to headings, titles, paragraphs, lists, etc. You can also select formatted text in your document to create a style in the Styles gallery.
1. Right-click on the text on which you want to base a new style.
2. In the mini-toolbar that appears, click Styles, then click Create Style.
3. In the dialog box, name your style then click OK.
Your new style now appears in the Styles gallery.



Facilitate the layout of your documents with section breaks

Section breaks help to organize your document and facilitate the layout, it's ideal for your long documents.
To add a section break:
1) Click on the Layout tab of the main ribbon
2) Then click on Breaks.
3) Finally, click on Next Page.
Once your section break is complete, you will be able to change the orientation of the section you are in without affecting the whole document. Similarly, you can change the header and footer of the specific section.



Vary your title themes with styles

In your Word document, apply styles to titles and subtitles. Later on, you can use these styles to create a table of contents at the beginning of your document.
Styles are proposed by default in the Home tab of the ribbon. You can modify the style of an existing title:
1. right-click on the style of your choice and click on Modify.
2.In the window that opens, you can change the style's formatting: font, size, color, etc. This allows you to vary the styles and thus have visually striking titles in your document.
3.Click on the Format button at the bottom left of the window to access all the options for customizing your title.
4.Select Numbering to insert an automatic numbering to the titles. Select the numbering style of your choice from the list and click OK.
You can also create your own style templates:
5.click on the Other arrow to display all styles from the ribbon
6. Then click on Create a style.
7. In the window that opens, name your style
8.Finally click on Modify to customize your style by defining a font style, a numbering, a specific tab, etc. This style will be displayed in the window that opens.
This style will be displayed in the quick style gallery in the ribbon, so you can access it quickly and use it with one click in your document.



Customize your headers and footers

To change the header or footer of your document:
1. Double-click on either one on a page of your document.
2. Via the contextual tab Header and Footer , you can add various information: images, current date and time, etc.
On the left side of the ribbon, you have a Header and a Footer button with custom layouts and themes.
You can change the header and footer at any time by double clicking on them and changing the elements of your choice.



Add page numbers

To add page numbers:
1.Double-click on the header or footer on any page in your section.
2.In the Header and Footer command group, click on Page Number.
3. Select the location where you want to insert the page number
4. Finally, select the style of the page number you wish to apply



Track changes in a document

In Word, you can enable Track Changes when working alone on a file or when working with others on a file.
To enable change tracking:
1. Click on the Review tab on the Ribbon
2. Click on Track changes
Now when you add or delete content, it will be highlighted in your document
3.The Track changes command group allows you to customize the follow-up. You can display for everyone or just yours tracking marks.
4.The Changes command group allows you to review your changes: Accept/reject changes, go to the next or previous change in your document.



Add logo and text to your document

To add a logo or text to your header or footer:
1.Double-click on either one on any page in your section.
2.In the Header and Footer command group, you can add a custom date, a picture
3.To add text, simply type your text in the header or footer and use the classic formatting tools via the Home tab of the ribbon.



Create a table of contents

In a Word document, it is easy to insert a table of contents. Tables of contents generate an overview of the different parts of your document.
They are very useful to easily find a page.
1)You will need to have previously defined styles for your titles. You will find all the styles in the Home tab of the main ribbon.
The styles that will be included in the automatic summary must be of type Title (1,2,3...). The number associated to the Title style will correspond to the level where the title will be in the summary.
Once your styles are defined, you can create your table of contents:
2) Go to the page where you want to insert the table of contents and open the References tab of the main ribbon
3) Then click on Table of Contents on the left side of the ribbon
4) Select the Automatic Table 1 to insert it in your page
5) Later, if you make changes to your plan, easily update the table of contents by clicking on Update Table above it. You can then update only the page numbers or the entire table.



Merging and mailing

Mailing is a feature that allows you to personalize a basic document before sending it to many recipients.
It is possible to create a mailing for various documents such as envelopes, labels, form letters or numbered coupons.
To use the mailing feature :
1. First create your document template in Word
2. Open the Mailings tab in the ribbon
3. Click on the Start Merge and Mail option
4. Select the document type: letters, mails, envelopes, labels, directory
5. Then choose the recipient data source:
-New list
-Existing list
-Recipients in Outlook contacts
6. Insert the merge fields in the document. These are the fields that will appear in the document based on the information in the recipient list such as last name, first name, address, city, etc.
7. Use the Preview Results option to preview the final documents
8.click on Finish and Merge, you will then be able to:
-Make a specific change to a document, for example if you need to add items for a recipient
-Print the documents
-Send the documents by mail -Print the documents



Create a new mailing list

From Word, you can create a new mailing list to send a similar document (envelopes, labels, form letters, ...) to many recipients:
1) Click on the Mailings tab in the ribbon.
2) Then click on Select Recipients and on Type a New List.
3) In the window that opens, fill in the first line
4) To add a contact to the list, click on New Entry.
5) You can customize the columns and add the information you want by clicking on Customize columns.
6) Once your list is created, click on Ok**.
7) Finally, save your list to the location of your choice in your file explorer



Select an existing list

From Word, you can use an existing Mailing List* to send a similar document (envelopes, labels, form letters, ...) to many recipients:
1. Click on the Mailings tab in the ribbon
2. Then click on Select Recipients and on Use an Existing List.
3. Your file explorer will open, select your list (Excel, Access, Word) and click on Open.
4. A new window opens in Word, click on Ok to validate the scope of your list



Use an Outlook contact list

From Word, to create and send an email to each contact in an Outlook list you can use an Outlook contact list :
1) Click on the Publishing tab in the ribbon.
2) Then click on Select Recipients and on Choose from Outlook Contacts.
3) A new window will open, select the Contact list and click on Ok
Once your list is open, you can :
4) Uncheck contacts so that they are not part of the sending list
5) Search for duplicates
6) Use the filter options to find a contact
7) Once your list is validated, click on Ok**.



Other Word features

Word is a well-known tool that allows you to write a wide variety of documents. It offers various very useful features:



Use spelling suggestions

In Word, in the Home tab of the ribbon, you have a Editor button that reviews your document to make suggestions for spelling, grammar, but also for writing style (informal language, conciseness, vocabulary, ...).
This feature is also very useful when you work in another language. Indeed, spelling suggestions are provided in more than 80 languages to help you communicate clearly, whatever the language you are writing in.
To Change the way Word reviews and corrects your text:
1. Click on Review then on Editor
2. In the window that opens, Enable or disable the various settings 3.
3. Close the window to confirm your selection



Focus mode on Word

Use the Focus mode to optimize the display of your document and focus only on the text and not on the buttons and different displays in Word.
To activate the Focus mode:
1. Click on the View tab of the Ribbon
2. Click on Focus in the Immersion command group
3. Once activated, all the buttons and options in Word will be hidden so that you can focus on the text only.
4. You can display the ribbon (and thus access all the options) by placing your mouse cursor at the top of the page. Click in the middle of the page to make the ribbon disappear again.
5. To exit the Focus mode and return to the initial view, click the Escape key on your keyboard.



Immersive reader

In Word, you have an Immersive reader button that allows you to improve your document reading skills through different tools.
To use the Immersive reader :
1. Open the View tab of the Ribbon
2. Then click on the Immersive reader button in the Immersion command group
In the immersive tools, you have several features at your disposal:
3.Column Width: allows you to change the length of the columns for a better viewing of the page. This option improves the reading comprehension of the document.
4. Page Color: Allows you to change the color of the page to avoid visual fatigue.
5.Line focus : allows you to focus on a specific part of the text. With the line focus mode you can focus on one, three or five lines of your document.
6. Text Spacing: Allows you to increase the space between words and lines. This option makes your document more airy for a better reading experience.
7.Syllables: highlights the pauses that should be made between syllables to improve the pronunciation of the text in your document for optimal reading.
8. Read aloud: allows you to listen to the content of your document aloud. Position yourself at the beginning of the text you wish to listen to and click on Read aloud. Each word read is highlighted as it is read.
9. To exit the learning tool and return to the classic view, click on Close Immersive Reader**.



Compare 2 versions of the same document

To compare two versions of the same document if, for example, you have created copies of a document:
1) Click on the Review tab of the Ribbon
2) Then click on Compare and again on Compare in the list
3) A window opens, click on the file icon to select the original document, do the same for the revised document and click on OK.
4) A new window opens with both documents, the differences between the two documents are highlighted, so you can compare them.



Editing a PDF document from Word

To open a PDF document in Word :
1) Right click on it from your file explorer
2) Choose the option Open with Word.
3) If Word does not appear in the list, click on Choose another application.
4) In the window that opens, select the application Word, click on Ok to validate
5) In Word, a window opens, click on Ok to accept. The PDF file is then converted into an editable Word document.
: If you had graphics in your PDF document, for example, the formatting may not be exactly the same, you can of course make changes and format the document.



Insert a cover page

In Word, to insert a cover page:
1. Go to the first page of your document
2. Then click on the Insert Ribbon tab and click on Cover Page.
3. Select a Cover page style from the list
Your cover page is inserted in your document, you can customize the content: Title, author, date, change the colors, add images and icons, etc.



Turn your document into a web page

With Word, you can transform a document into a web page, which is very useful for example to include it in a website.
To do this:
1. Click on the File tab of your document, then on Export in the left ribbon
2. Select Change file type.
3. Then click on Single File Web Page.
Your document is now available as a web page. You will be able to edit, share or embed it in a website.



Word keyboard tips

The most convenient shortcuts to use to boost your productivity:
Ctrl+x: Cut
Ctrl+c: Copy
Ctrl+v: Paste
Ctrl+z : Undo
Ctrl+a: Select all
Ctrl+n: New
Ctrl+o: Open
Ctrl+p: Print
Ctrl+i: Italicize or italicize the selection. Another method uses automatic correction.
Ctrl+g: Bold or make the selection bold. Another method uses automatic correction.
Alt+Shift+d: Inserts the current date.
F1: Calls the companion or opens the online help
F4: Repeats the last action
F3: Insert an automatic correction
F5: Opens the reach dialog box
F7: Starts the spelling and grammar correction
F8: Switches to extension mode
F9: Updates the selected fields
F10: Activates the menu bar
F11: Next field
F12: Opens the Save As dialog box
Ctrl+F6: Switches between files
Shift+F1: Display the text formatting by clicking on it
Shift+F7: Opens the synonyms dialog box

Ajouter un participant en cours de r√©union

G√©rer les salles de r√©union

Les salles de r√©union dans Teams vous permettent de s√©parer la r√©union principale en plusieurs groupes. Cela peut √™tre envisag√© pour faciliter un travail de brainstorming par exemple.
1. Pour cr√©er des salles de r√©union, cliquez sur le bouton correspondant dans la barre d'action de la r√©union
2. Choisissez le nombre de salles dont vous avez besoin et d√©finissez si vous souhaitez affecter les participants manuellement ou automatiquement dans les salles
3. Cliquez sur Cr√©er des salles
4. Une fois les salles cr√©√©es, cliquez sur Attribuer des participants
5. S√©lectionnez les participants √† affecter dans une salle
6. Et cliquez sur Attribuer pour choisir la salle
7. Vos salles sont ferm√©es par d√©faut, pour les ouvrir, cliquez sur D√©marrer les salles. Les participants sont alors dispatch√©s dans les salles dans lesquelles ils ont √©t√© affect√©s.
8. En tant qu'organisateur, vous pouvez passer d'une salle √† une autre en cliquant sur les ... devant une salle puis sur Rejoindre la salle
9. Une fois dans la salle, retournez √† la r√©union principale en cliquant sur le bouton Retour.
10. Lorsque vous avez termin√©, fermez les salles en cliquant sur le bouton Fermer les salles
11. Vous pouvez √©galement les fermer individuellement en cliquant sur les ... devant leur nom puis sur Fermer la salle




Permettre aux participants de revenir √† la salle de r√©union principale

Lorsque les participants sont assign√©s √† une salle, ils ne pourront pas revenir √† la r√©union principale tant que l'organisateur n'a pas ferm√© leur salle de d√©rivation.
Vous pouvez changer cela l'organisateur doit :
1. Cliquez sur les ... en haut du volet de gestion des salles de d√©rivation
2. Choisissez Param√®tres des salles
3. Activer Les participants peuvent retourner dans la r√©union principale



Restreindre l'acc√®s √† une r√©union

Une nouvelle fonctionnalit√© est disponible permettant √† l'organisateur de verrouiller une r√©union et restreindre ainsi toute tentative de connexion m√™me pour les invit√©s retardataires.
Toute personne tentant de rejoindre une r√©union verrouill√©e est inform√©e par un message indiquant qu'elle ne peut pas la rejoindre car elle est verrouill√©e par l'organisateur.
1. D√©marrez une r√©union au sein de Microsoft Teams.
2. Cliquez sur l'ic√¥ne Afficher les participants .
3. Cliquez sur les ‚Äú‚Ä¶‚Äù √† c√¥t√© de Participants.
4. S√©lectionnez Verrouiller la r√©union.

N.B: Pour d√©verrouiller la r√©union, vous pouvez simplement suivre les m√™mes √©tapes mais s√©lectionner ‚ÄúD√©verrouiller‚Äù.



Projeter du contenu lors d'une r√©union

Familiariser vous avec l'interface OneNote

Consid√©rez OneNote comme une armoire contenant des classeurs (les bloc-notes), chaque classeur contenant des pages s√©par√©es par des intercalaires (les sections).
Vous pouvez organiser vos bloc-notes comme vous le souhaitez : r√©partir vos notes dans des onglets diff√©rents par th√©matique (par exemple : un onglet par projet ou par client) puis par page (par exemple : par type d‚Äôinformation).
1. Dans le volet de navigation, vous verrez vos bloc-notes. Au d√©but vous n‚Äôaurez que votre propre bloc-notes et au fil de vos partages vous verrez les blocs-notes partag√©s apparaitre dans ce volet.
2. Les sections sont des intercalaires, vous pouvez les organiser comme vous le souhaitez : par sujet, par projet, ...
3. Vous pouvez ajouter autant de pages que vous le souhaitez, en cliquant sur Ajouter une page
4. Pour ajouter une section cliquez sur le symbole + √† droite et saisissez le nom, puis validez en pressant la touche Entr√©e de votre clavier

Cliquez ici pour lire la vid√©o ‚èØ



Ajouter une section

Les sections sont des intercalaires, vous pouvez les organiser comme vous le souhaitez : par sujet, par projet, .... Toutefois, vous pouvez cr√©er autant de sections que vous voulez.
1. Pour ajouter une section cliquez sur le symbole + √† droite, vous pouvez aussi utiliser le raccourci clavier Ctrl+T
2. Entrez un nom pour la nouvelle section, puis appuyez sur Entrer depuis votre clavier.
3. Les nouvelles sections contiennent toujours une nouvelle page vierge. Vous pouvez commencer √† prendre des notes sur cette page, cr√©er d'autres pages

N.B : OneNote vous offre la possibilt√© de d√©placer des pages existantes vers d'autres sections ou d'autres bloc-notes avec simple cliquer-glisser.

- Les personnes au sein de votre organisation disposant du lien : Tous les employ√©s auront acc√®s √† votre document s'ils ont le lien √† disposition. Attention si le document comporte des informations sensibles car un lien peut √™tre partag√© !
- Personnes ayant d√©j√† acc√®s : Utilisez cette option si vous souhaitez envoyer un lien vers le document √† une personne ayant d√©j√† acc√®s √† celui-ci.
- Des personnes sp√©cifiques : Donne acc√®s uniquement aux personnes sp√©cifi√©es. Il s'agit de l'option la plus recommand√©e et la plus s√©curis√©e. Utilisez cette option pour partager un document avec un destinataire externe.

R√©aliser vos premiers calculs

Les formules de calcul effectuent des calculs sur les valeurs contenues dans votre feuille de calcul. Une formule commence par un signe √©gal (=) et peut contenir les √©l√©ments suivants :
Des r√©f√©rences de cellules (exemple : A1,B1,C1,...)
Des op√©rateurs :
-les op√©rateurs arithm√©tiques : (-, +, /, * , ^,...)
-les op√©rateurs de comparaison : (=, <, <=, >,>=, <>)
-un op√©rateur de concat√©nation de texte : (")
-les op√©rateurs de r√©f√©rence : (:,;)



Calculer avec les Op√©rateurs arithm√©tiques

Vous pouvez cr√©er une formule simple avec les op√©rateurs arithm√©tiques pour ajouter, soustraire, multiplier ou diviser des valeurs dans votre feuille de calcul. Les formules simples commencent toujours par un signe √©gal (=), suivi de constantes qui sont des valeurs num√©riques et des op√©rateurs arithm√©tiques.
Exemple:
1.Dans la feuille de calcul, cliquez sur la cellule dans laquelle vous souhaitez entrer la formule.
2.Tapez le signe √©gal (= ), suivi des r√©f√©rences cellulaires A1+B1
3.Appuyez sur Entr√©e

N.B :
1.Tapez =5+2*3 dans une autre cellule, puis appuyez sur Entr√©e. > Vous remarquez que Excel multiplie les deux derniers nombres et ajoute le premier nombre au r√©sultat.
En suivant l‚Äôordre standard des op√©rations math√©matiques, la multiplication et la division sont effectu√©es avant l‚Äôaddition et la soustraction et la division avant la multiplication, l'addition ou la soustraction.

1.Saisissez votre formule, une fois la cellule s√©lectionn√©e, cliquez sur la touche F4.
2.La r√©f√©rence de la cellule pr√©sente maintenant le caract√®re $ devant la lettre de colonne et devant le num√©ro de ligne : $A$1
3.Terminez la saisie de la formule puis validez en cliquant sur OK
N.B: Lorsque vous appuyez sur la touche F4, vous obtenez une r√©f√©rence absolue de cellule ; si vous appuyez sur F4 une seconde fois, seule la r√©f√©rence de la ligne devient absolue ; si vous appuyez sur celle-ci une troisi√®me fois, c‚Äôest alors la r√©f√©rence de la colonne qui devient absolue.

Utiliser les mod√®les de graphiques

L‚Äôobjectif d‚Äôun graphique est d'afficher vos analyses de donn√©es. Cependant un certain type de graphique n‚Äôest pas toujours adapt√© √† tous les types de valeurs. C'est la raison pour laquelle Excel vous propose un large choix de mod√®les de graphiques selon les donn√©es de votre tableau :
1.Histogramme ou Graphique √† barres: Les donn√©es de tableaux simples peuvent √™tre repr√©sent√©es sous forme de colonnes verticales et de barres horizontales.
2.Graphique en courbes ou en aires: Les √©volutions (dans le temps) peuvent √™tre repr√©sent√©es par des lignes associ√©es.
3.Graphique en secteurs ou en anneaux: Pour repr√©senter au mieux une r√©partition, les graphiques circulaires ou en anneaux sont parfaitement adapt√©s. La surface totale doit alors correspondre √† la valeur 100 pour cent.
4.Graphique hi√©rarchique: permet de repr√©senter au mieux les interd√©pendances
5.nuage de points (X,Y) ou un graphique en bulles: Les gros volumes de donn√©es peuvent √©galement √™tre repr√©sent√©s par des points (de couleur identique ou variable) dans un syst√®me de coordonn√©es.
6.Graphique en cascade, boursier, ou en radar: Lorsque les valeurs sont plac√©es en lien avec un point central, ce graphique permet leur agencement autour de ce point.



Trier et filter vos donn√©es

Le tri est un des outils les plus courants pour la gestion des donn√©es. Dans Excel, vous pouvez trier votre tableau sur une ou plusieurs colonnes, en ordre croissant ou d√©croissant, ou effectuer un tri personnalis√©.

Fonctions de bases de donn√©es

Les tableurs fournissent g√©n√©ralement un grand nombre de fonctions int√©gr√©es permettant de r√©aliser des manipulations de donn√©es.
La syntaxe d'une fonction
Une fonction est caract√©ris√©e par son nom (par convention √©crit en majuscule), suivi de parenth√®se. Elle peut √©ventuellement contenir des arguments (√† l'int√©rieur des parenth√®ses), c'est-√†-dire un ensemble de valeurs, s√©par√©es par des points-virgules, auxquelles la fonction s'applique. Ainsi une fonction appel√© FONCTION se notera de la fa√ßon suivante :
FONCTION(argument1; argument2; ...)



Somme.SI

La fonction SOMME.SI permet de calculer la somme des valeurs d‚Äôune plage qui r√©pond au crit√®re sp√©cifi√©. Par exemple, supposons que dans la colonne B, vous avez saisie des noms d'articles (Jupes, Tee-shirts, pantalon, ...), dans la colonne D, les ventes r√©alis√©es.
Vous souhaitez calculer le CA uniquement des ventes des "Jupes"
Vous pouvez utiliser la formule suivante : =SOMME.SI(B2:B25,"*Jupes*"; D2:D25)
B2:B25 correspond √† la plage de cellule ou le crit√®re est cit√©, ici les articles.
"*Jupes*" le crit√®re recherch√©, si votre crit√®re est un texte, mettez une asterix avant et apr√®s exemple : "*texte*"
D2:D25 correspond aux ventes et donc ua CA
La syntaxe de la fonction SOMME.SI contient les arguments suivants :
SOMME.SI(plage;crit√®re;[somme_plage])



NB.SI

NB.SI, est l‚Äôune des fonctions Statistiques qui permet de compter le nombre de cellules qui r√©pondent √† un crit√®re ; par exemple, pour compter le nombre de fois o√π le nom d‚Äôune ville appara√Æt dans une liste de clients.
Dans sa forme la plus simple, la fonction NB.SI se d√©compose ainsi :
=NB.SI(o√π voulez-vous rechercher ?;que voulez-vous rechercher ?)
Par exemple :
=NB.SI(A2:A5;"pommes")
Compte le nombre de cellules contenant ¬´ pommes ¬ª dans la plage allant de A2 √† A5. Le r√©sultat est 2.



NB.SI.ENS

La fonction NB.SI.ENS applique les crit√®res aux cellules de plusieurs plages et compte le nombre de fois o√π tous les crit√®res sont remplis.
Syntaxe :
NB.SI.ENS(plage_crit√®res1; crit√®res1; [plage_crit√®res2; crit√®res2]‚Ä¶)
Exemple :
=NB.SI.ENS(B2:D2;"=Oui")
> Compte le nombre de fois que Davidoski a d√©pass√© un quota de ventes pour les p√©riodes T1, T2 et T3, le r√©sultat est 1



RechercheV

RECHERCHEV() est une fonction permettant de rechercher et d'extraire les donn√©es d'une colonne sp√©cifique dans une table. On pourra, par exemple, trouver la d√©signation et le prix unitaire d'un produit en saisissant simplement sa r√©f√©rence.
La syntaxe est la suivante :
=RECHERCHEV(valeur_cherch√© ; table matrice ; num√©ro_de_colonne; valeur proche)
Exemple : =RECHERCHEV(B6;B6:E11;4;FAUX)
- la valeur_cherch√© est "B6" : il s'agit de la cellule de r√©f√©rence o√π Excel va trouver la valeur qui lancera la recherche (exemple : la r√©f√©rence d'un produit conduit √† la recherche de son prix et de sa d√©signation).
- la table matrice "B6:E11": il s'agit de la plage de cellules o√π Excel recherche les valeurs (exemple : un tarif comportant prix et d√©signations des produits).
- le num√©ro_de_colonne est "4": il s'agit du num√©ro de la colonne du tableau o√π Excel doit trouver la valeur cherch√©e (exemple : les prix se trouvent dans la troisi√®me colonne du tarif)
- valeur proche : Faux

Consolider vos donn√©es

Vous vous √™tes retrouv√©s avec des donn√©es similaires sur de nombreux fichiers Excel, et vous souhaitez consolider ces donn√©es dans un tableau r√©capitulatif ?

On distingue deux types de consolidation:
- Consolidation par cat√©gorie : les √©tiquettes des lignes et colonnes sont identiques d'une liste √† l'autre, cela permet √† Excel de savoir quelles donn√©es doivent √™tre cumul√©es.
- Consolidation par position : les √©tiquettes des lignes ou colonnes figurent dans la m√™me position dans chaque liste, Excel ne tiendra pas en compte si celle ci sont √©crites de mani√®re identique ou pas.

Quelques r√®gles avant de commencer

Pour r√©ussir la construction de votre Tableaux Crois√©s Dynamiques (TCD), vous devez respecter quelques r√®gles:
- La 1√®re ligne contient les noms de champs qui doivent √™tre uniques. Exemple : ne pas m√©langer CP et Ville
- Une ligne est un enregistrement de donn√©es
-Ne laisser aucune ligne ni colonne enti√®rement vide
-Ne fusionner pas de cellules du tableau
-Ne pas int√©grer de lignes de synth√®se (somme, moyenne‚Ä¶)

1. Appuyez simultan√©ment sur les touches [Ctrl] et [R]
2. Pour augmenter le retrait, appuyez une nouvelle fois sur les touches [Ctrl] et [R].
3. Pour annuler tous les retraits, appuyez simultan√©ment sur les touches [Ctrl] et [Q]

G√©rer les tabulations avec Word

Pour s√©parer et aligner parfaitement du texte ou des nombres, oubliez la barre d'espace et ses r√©sultats approximatifs !
Ayez le bon r√©flexe dans Word et dans tous les traitements de texte en utilisant les tabulations.



Cr√©er des Tabulations

Pour s√©parer et aligner parfaitement du texte ou des nombres, oubliez la barre d'espace! Ayez le bon r√©flexe et utiliser les tabulations.
Pour choisir une tabulation :
1. Cliquez sur l'extr√©mit√© gauche de la r√®gle horizontale
2. Choisissez une des 4 types de tabulations propos√©s par Word : Gauche, droite, centr√©, et d√©cimale
3. Cliquez sur la r√®gle √† l'endroit voulu, Word placera alors un taquet de tabulation sur la r√®gle



D√©placer, modifier, et supprimer une tabulation

Pour d√©placer une tabulation :
1. Cliquez sur le taquet et maintenez le bouton de la souris enfonc√©
2. Glissez le taquet vers la droite ou vers la gauche

Pour modifier une tabulation :
1. Double-cliquez sur le taquet de tabulation
2. Depuis la boite de dialogue qui s'ouvre, choisissez la position de tabulation √† modifier
3. S√©lectionnez le type d'alignement choisi
4. Cliquez sur D√©finir
5. Enfin, s√©lectionnez Ok

Pour supprimer une tabulation :
1. Cliquez sur le taquet de tabulation
2. Glissez le en dehors de la r√®gle, vers la page du document

N.B : Si la tabulation s'applique √† plusieurs paragraphes, il est indispensable de les s√©lectionner pour appliquer la modification √† l'ensemble



Utiliser les tabulations avec des points de suite

Les points de suite tracent une ligne de pointill√©s, de tirets ou une ligne continue √† gauche du taquet auquel vous les appliquez.
1. Double-cliquez sur la tabulation plac√©e dans la r√®gle
2. Depuis Position , choisissez la tabulation sur laquelle les points de suites sont √† appliquer
3. Cliquez sur le type de points de suite choisi
4. Cliquez sur D√©finir puis sur Ok



Word et les fonctionnalit√©s avanc√©es

Les Tableaux dans Word

Dans ce chapitre, vous apprendrez √† ins√©rer et mettre en forme des tableaux dans Word.



Cr√©er un tableau

Un tableau est compos√© de lignes et de colonnes. La zone rectangulaire situ√©e √† l'intersection d'une ligne et d'une colonne est appel√©e cellule
Pour cr√©er un tableau dans Word :
1. Cliquez sur l'onglet Insertion
2. Cliquez sur le bouton Tableau
3. D√©placez le pointeur de la souris jusqu'√† l'endroit voulu pour indiquer le nombre de lignes et de colonnes.
4. Cliquez sur la derni√®re cellule, votre tableau sera ins√©r√© dans votre document Word



Uniformiser les colonnes et lignes de votre tableau

La modification de la largeur des colonnes et la hauteur des lignes n'est pas toujours pr√©cises. Il est donc important de les uniformiser pour les rendre √©gales .
Pour uniformiser la largeur des colonnes de votre tableau :
1. S√©lectionnez votre tableau, ensuite cliquez sur l'onglet Mise en pagequi apparait dans le ruban ,
2. Dans le bloc Taille de la cellule
3. Cliquez sur Uniformiser les colonnes

Pour uniformiser la hauteur des lignes de votre tableau :
1. S√©lectionnez l'onglet Mise en page,
2. Dans le bloc Taille de la cellule
3. Cliquez sur Uniformiser les lignes



Ins√©rer un Tableau Excel

Cr√©er un tableau dans Excel offre bien plus de fonctionnalit√© qu‚Äôun simple tableau Word. Vous pouvez toutefois inclure le tableau Excel dans un document Word.
1. Depuis l'onglet Insertion, cliquez sur Tableau
2. Cliquez ensuite sur Feuille de calcul Excel
3. Saisissez vos donn√©es dans la fen√™tre Excel

1. Cliquez n‚Äôimporte o√π dans le tableau que vous voulez modifier. Les outils de tableau apparaissent au-dessus du ruban.
2. Depuis l'onglet Mise en page, les options permettant d‚Äôins√©rer et de supprimer des lignes et des colonnes apparaissent dans le bloc Lignes et colonnes
3. Placez votre curseur √† l‚Äôendroit du tableau o√π vous souhaitez ajouter une colonne ou une ligne.
- Pour ins√©rer une ligne, cliquez sur ins√©rer au-dessus ou Ins√©rer en dessous.
- Pour ins√©rer une colonne, cliquez sur Ins√©rer √† gauche ou ins√©rer √† droite.
4. Pour supprimer des colonnes et des lignes, placez votre curseur sur la colonne ou ligne concern√©, s√©lectionnez sur le bouton Supprimer et cliquez sur l'action de votre choix .

7.Utilisez l'option Aper√ßu des r√©sultats afin d'avoir un aper√ßu des documents finaux

Autres fonctionnalit√©s de Word

Word est un outil connu de tous vous permettant de r√©diger des documents vari√©s. Il offre diverses fonctionnalit√©s tr√®s utiles :

Utilisez le mode Focus pour optimiser l'affichage de votre document et vous concentrez uniquement sur le texte et non sur les boutons et les diff√©rents affichages dans Word.
Pour activer le mode Focus :
1.Cliquez sur l'onglet Affichage du ruban
2.Puis cliquez sur Focus dans le groupe de commandes Immersion
3.Une fois activ√©, tous les boutons et options de Word seront masqu√©s pour ne laisser place qu'au texte et ainsi vous permettre de vous focaliser pleinement sur celui-ci.
4.Vous pouvez afficher le ruban (et ainsi acc√©der √† toutes les options) en pla√ßant le curseur de votre souris en haut de la page. Cliquez au milieu de la page pour faire √† nouveau dispara√Ætre le ruban.
5.Pour sortir du mode Focus et revenir √† l'affichage initial, cliquez sur la touche Echap de votre clavier.

Comparer 2 versions d'un m√™me document

Quelle est la nature de la r√©union ?



-GPT-Sep-

##fin##

##fin##

Vous pouvez choisir en fonction de vos besoins d'utiliser une IA ou une autre. Des tests sont r√©alis√©s r√©guli√®rement pour identifier les points forts de chacune des IA

Alors qu‚Äôest ce que des donn√©es personnelles ?Une donn√©e personnelle est toute information permettant d‚Äôidentifier un √™tre humain. Qu‚Äôest-ce que les donn√©es personnelles ?
Une donn√©e personnelle est toute information se rapportant √† une personne physique identifi√©e ou identifiable.
Une personne physique peut √™tre identifi√©e :

- Indirectement (ex : num√©ro de t√©l√©phone

√Ä SAVOIR

-GPT-Sep-

-GPT-Sep-
